story:
This holiday season, support Selections from Rodgers and Hammerstein’s Carousel,  a benefit concert for Connections for Abused Women and Children. 

 

ABOUT THE BENEFIT

In support of Connections for Abused Women and Children (CAWC), a local Chicago non-profit organization that provides shelter, counseling, advocacy and a 24-hour hotline for people affected by domestic abuse, a select group of rising and established Chicago artists will perform a benefit concert of selections from Rodgers’ and Hammerstein’s Carousel. 

A groundbreaking piece of theatre when it premiered in 1945, Rodgers and Hammerstein’s Carousel tackled the dark and largely unspoken issue of family violence in a format typically reserved for light entertainment. Based on the play Liliom by Ferenc Molnar, Carousel is an examination of Julie Jordan and Billy Bigelow’s troubled relationship, giving a window into domestic abuse that continues to be troubling and challenging to our modern ears.

Through this benefit concert, we aim to raise visibility for both this issue and this remarkable organization. The performance will be free to all, with the ability to donate to Connections for Abused Women and Children as well as more information on their services at the door.

 

PRODUCTION INFORMATION

Director: Michael Holtzman
Music Director: Elizabeth Doran
Production Manager: Mary Hungerford

Cast:
Brittany Bookbinder
David Catlin
Madeline Duffy-Feins
Matt Edmonds
J. Michael Finley
Jon Harrison
Jessica Kingsdale
Nate Lewellyn
Will Skrip
Kacy Smith
Heather Townsend

Selections from Rodger and Hammerstein's Carousel: A Benefit Concert for Connections for Abused Women and Children will be performed on Monday, December 10th and Tuesday, December 11th at 7:30PM at Theatre Wit, located at 1229 W. Belmont Ave, Chicago IL 60657.  Both performances are free to the public, but donations for CAWC are strongly encouraged and will be collected at the door.  

For more details about the benefit concert, please do not hesitate to contact Mary, our production manager, at hungerfordmary@gmail.com.

 

SUPPORT US

This benefit could not be made possible without your support!  In order to cover overhead costs for this performance, we are reaching out to you! The money you donate will go towards space rental, performer stipends and other costs incurred. Anything over our goal will be donated directly to Connections for Abused Women and Children. For more information on Connections for Abused Women and Children visit their website at:www.cawc.org.

story:
Short Summary

There are So many talented actors, designers, and other performing artists who want to work, but not enough theater companies to give it to them. We want to be that opportunity.

  • Nick Palenchar has extensive production and directing experience and strong entrepreneurial skills. He's formed self-sustained organizations and improved the theatre club as President back in college. He's taught theatre to all ages from children to adults through festivals, schools, and summer camps.
  • Julie D'Moure has connections to many artists in the New York area and has already secured performances spaces and talent to help contribute to our production
  • The Show will be either Songs for a new World or The Last Five Years, both beautifully written and challenging musicals.

What We Need

In detail, we break down our budget to these minimum requirements.

  • $175 - Violinist
  • $175 - Cellist
  • $130 - Choreographer
  • $170 - Set/Costumes
  • $400 - Royalties
  • $400 - Score rentals
  • TOTAL: $1,450
  • Our goal is to raise two thirds of the total fund, totaling about $1,000
  • This is a bare minimum and we hope to raise more!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone is in a financial position to make a contribution. Please consider to help spread the word:

  • Share our campaign page on facebook or twitter
  • Send encouragement to gous@unhingedtheatre.org. Positive thoughts really can go a long way!

story:
Folk Dance Remixed believes in diversity, creativity and spreading joy. Our shows and workshops show off the best that can be achieved when people work together, sharing their cultures, their music, their dance moves - their positivity! Our inspiring workshops get families up and dancing together and strangers holding hands and laughing within minutes, our work truly touches all that come into contact with it!

Our current show, Step Hop House, depicts the coming together of diverse travellers to new land and how they work and play together – mixing together folk, hip-hop, live music, Bollywood, capoeira, African, contemporary, beatbox and maypole traditions into a funky folkyness!

What We Need & What You Get

We need £2250 from our crowdfunding appeal to help us devise new shows and participatory workshops for children, young people, families and adults.

Your help will enable us do more education work with young people and artists – training them and dance leaders with new choreography, devising new approaches of teaching, and working with musicians to make great accompaniments.

Your help will secure the creativity and research needed to bring new ideas and formats to rehearsal, and enable the company to spend valuable time developing our innovative brand of funked up folkyness to delight audiences across the country. It will contribute to studio time for the artistic directors to experiment and devise; rehearsal costs for the company; costume development; technical experimentation and equipment (those maypole ribbons need to be shiny and perfect each time you see them!).

Every £1 donation helps make our grants and support go further and helps secure our hard work and innovation. Our crowdfunding donations will be combined with our current Arts Council England grant, and our in-kind support from partners East London Dance and the English Folk Dance and Song Society.
Please donate what you can to keep this joyous and eclectic company pushing forwards into the ground breaking territory. Every £1 helps keeps us creating! THANK YOU!

The Impact

Our work brings people together – it creates connections, makes people laugh and enjoy a dynamic and colourful spectacle. Don’t take our word for it – here’s some comments from people that have worked with us and seen our work themselves:

 “It was wonderful to see so many young people from across the North West performing at the beginning of U Dance 2016.  The blend of traditional folk dance and contemporary hip hop clearly enabled all the young people to express their individuality.  The piece seemed to bring folk dance to life for a new generation and the energy and obvious enthusiasm of the performers was infectious!  It was great to see traditional folk dance embraced as a vibrant part of young people’s dance in the UK.” 

Ginny Brown, Head of Education & Training, Imperial Society of Teachers of Dancing

 

We received some wonderful comments about your performances and workshops and how they were engaging and inclusive as well as visually stunning!

Rachel Wood, Arts Development Officer, Oldham Council

 

The dancers were wonderful, as were the musicians, and I was thrilled to see the fantastic ceilidh take-up at the end, bought a lump to my throat as these things always do when done so well.

Michael Hambridge, Arts and Cultural Development Officer, Hastings Borough Council

 

Street Dance the Maypole was a brilliant visual focal point, filling the space with colours and energy. The teachers were quick to adapt the level of the workshop to the ability of the participants ... everyone really enjoyed themselves!

Lina Johansson, Joint Artistic Director of Mimbre

 

Thank you again for making the show energetic and dynamic – everyone enjoyed your performance!  

Rozina Ahmed, Senior Events Officer, Events for London, Mayor’s Office

 ‘I just wanted to say how much I enjoyed the show last night – a great mix of dance styles blended into a cohesive performance full of energy, skill and a real sense of joy!  Lovely costumes and colourful props created a terrific environment in which to perform.  All the elements worked well (I loved the “mumming” reference!) and I can see the potential (as you surely can) for this to grow into a bigger show with educational aspects and huge workshop potential.’  

Barry Goodman, President of The Morris Federation

Opportunity to see cutting-edge real/ genuine “folk dance” of today. The sensational performance – when it finished I wanted to see it again, immediately. Loved the mix, meld and marriage of styles that is creating a new tradition.

Jacqueline Beattie, audience member 

Fabulous creative performance. The workshops are fun.

Dodie Lambminder, audience member

Risks & Challenges

We are always ducking and diving – being efficient and nifty with all our expenditure, reusing and revising our resources, our costumes, our admin and management, our sets and equipment… and ideas! We believe this is fundamental to our creativity and keeps us on our toes – but we also need additional support to have valuable time to think, plan, devise and develop into the future. This is where we need your support!  If we get the planning and devising right then we’re confident we can produce some stunning new ideas and performances – we’ve got so many great ideas, and just need some support to make those a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that money is tight. If you can’t contribute the hard cash you can still really help and support us by putting the word out to local event and festival promoters, schools, dance groups and dance agencies and tell them about our work. And you can pass on the news about this campaign and encourage people to join us!  THANK YOU!

story:
Hello! 

We are a NON-PROFIT musical theater group from Ankara, Turkey. We are basically a group of university students that have the spirit and motivation to do our best to put on musical shows with the best quality that we can and perform them to our community. The concept of “musical theater” is  relatively new to our community! Which is why we are in need of help financially to put on our shows. Putting on a show takes a significant budget.. We are in need of a budget for lights, a sound system, props, costumes and décor. You get the picture.. It’s expensive. The numbers we’re talking about is way in over our heads (as we are all students we can barely afford to live XD). Which is why we are trying any means to get money (nothing illegal relax..) which is why WE NEED YOUR HELP! Every dollar counts!

What  we want to stress is that no one in our group gets a penny for taking part in our shows. all donations go to the show. So in a way, we just give back to the community... This is our second year performing, and hopefully with your help, this is going to be our 4th show!

We always find a way to give back to our community! By donating, whatever the amount, you too will become a part of our community! And to thank you, we will give back to you too!

If you really want to help but you can't, you can help us by sharing our campaign on social media! 

-------------

Merhaba,

Müzikalleri ve sahnede olmayı çok ama çok seviyoruz! Bu tutkumuzu  hayata geçirmemiz için desteğinize ihtiyacımız var!  

Biz Ankara’da bir grup üniversite öğrencisinin bir araya gelerek oluşturduğu,  kar amacı gütmeyen bir müzikal tiyatro topluluğuyuz. Her birimiz en iyi kalitede müzikalleri sahneye koyabilmek için elinden gelenin en iyisini yapmaya kararlı ve bunun için  gereken ruh ve motivasyona sahibiz. Bir müzikali sahneye koyabilmek için önemli bir bütçe gerekiyor. Işıklar, ses sistemi, sahne, kostüm ve dekor bu bütçenin ön önemli kalemleri. Kısacası, bir müzikal sahneye koymak pahalı bir iş.  Öğrenci olmamız sebebi ile, bu maliyetler bizim boyumuzu aşıyor. Bu nedenle hayallerimizi gerçekleştirebilmek ve güzel bir müzikal sahneye koyabilmek için sizlerin finansal desteğine ihtiyacımız var. Bağışlayacağınız en küçük miktar bile bizi çok mutlu edecek.

Topluluğumuzda kimsenin gösteride yer almak için bir kuruş bile almadığını belirtmek isteriz. Tüm bağışlarınız doğrudan gösterimizin yapımında kullanılacak.

Topluluğumuz iki yıldır müzikal sahnelemekte. Sizin  de yardımınızla birlikte  bu yıl sonunda sahneye koyacağımız müzikal 4. Gösterimiz olacak ve sayenizde bugüne kadar olanlardan çok daha etkileyici olacak.

Her şekilde müzikal ve sanat kültürünü çevremizde yayarak, toplumumuza katkıda bulunuyoruz. Aslında siz de bağış yaparak topluluğumuzun bir parçası haline geliyorsunuz! Teşekkür ederiz!!

Eğer gerçekten yardım etmek istiyorsanız ama mümkün değilse, sosyal medyadan kampanyamızı paylaşarak da destek olabilirsiniz!

Bağışlarınız karşılığında size hediyelerimiz olacak!

Teşekkür Mektubu!

5 Dolar bağışlarsanız,  e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu göndereceğiz.

Teşekkür Videosu!

10 Dolar bağışlarsanız, e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu ile birlikte şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu göndereceğiz. Böylelikle yüzlerimizi görecek ve seslerimizi duyacaksınız!

İstediğiniz Kişi İçin Doğumgünü Şarkısı Videosu!

30 Dolar bağışlarsanız, e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu ile birlikte şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu göndereceğiz. Buna ek olarak , müzikal grubumuz tarafından istediğiniz kişi adına özel olarak doğum günü şarkısı videosu hazırlayıp göndereceğiz.  Bu muhteşem bir hediye, biz bağış yapabilseydik, kesinlikle bu hediyeyi tercih ederdik.

İsminiz  Altın Harflerle Oyun Programımızda!

50 Dolar bağışlarsanız, adınız oyun programımızda sponsor olarak yer alacak ve oyun fotoğrafları ile birlikte e-mail adresinize gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte. Meşhur olacaksınız! 

Oyun Programı ve Herşey!

75 Dolar bağışlarsanız, müzikal grubumuz tarafından istediğiniz kişi adına özel olarak doğum günü şarkısı videosu hazırlayıp göndereceğiz. Adınız oyun programımızda sponsor olarak yer alacak ve oyun fotoğrafları ile birlikte e-mail adresinize gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte!

İsminiz ve Gösterimiz!

100 Dolar bağışlarsanız isminiz oyun programımızda altın harflerle  sponsor olarak yer alacak. Aynı zamanda gösteri videomuzun  linki , gösterimizi takiben sadece size özel bir şifre ile tarafınıza gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte!  Mükemmel değil mi?

Sizin Etkinliğiniz ve Bizim Orkestramız!

600 Dolar bağışlarsanız, orkestramız seyahat masraflarını karşılamanız ve üç hafta öncesinde bilgilendirmeniz durumunda  dilediğiniz bir etkinliğinizde sahne alacaktır. Ses sistemi sizin sorumluluğunuzda olacaktır. Bu iyi bir teklif değilse, nedir?

The numbers we’re talking about is way in over our heads (as we are all students we can barely afford to live XD). Which is why we are trying any means to get money (nothing illegal relax..) which is why WE NEED YOUR HELP! Every dollar counts!
What  we want to stress is that no one in our group gets a penny for taking part in our shows. all donations go to the show. So in a way, we just give back to the community... This is our second year performing, and hopefully with your help, this is going to be our 4th show!
We always find a way to give back to our community! By donating, whatever the amount, you too will become a part of our community! And to thank you, we will give back to you too!
If you really want to help but you can't, you can help us by sharing our campaign on social media! -------------Merhaba,Müzikalleri ve sahnede olmayı çok ama çok seviyoruz! Bu tutkumuzu  hayata geçirmemiz için desteğinize ihtiyacımız var!  Biz Ankara’da bir grup üniversite öğrencisinin bir araya gelerek oluşturduğu,  kar amacı gütmeyen bir müzikal tiyatro topluluğuyuz. Her birimiz en iyi kalitede müzikalleri sahneye koyabilmek için elinden gelenin en iyisini yapmaya kararlı ve bunun için  gereken ruh ve motivasyona sahibiz. Bir müzikali sahneye koyabilmek için önemli bir bütçe gerekiyor. Işıklar, ses sistemi, sahne, kostüm ve dekor bu bütçenin ön önemli kalemleri. Kısacası, bir müzikal sahneye koymak pahalı bir iş.  Öğrenci olmamız sebebi ile, bu maliyetler bizim boyumuzu aşıyor. Bu nedenle hayallerimizi gerçekleştirebilmek ve güzel bir müzikal sahneye koyabilmek için sizlerin finansal desteğine ihtiyacımız var. Bağışlayacağınız en küçük miktar bile bizi çok mutlu edecek.Topluluğumuzda kimsenin gösteride yer almak için bir kuruş bile almadığını belirtmek isteriz. Tüm bağışlarınız doğrudan gösterimizin yapımında kullanılacak.Topluluğumuz iki yıldır müzikal sahnelemekte. Sizin  de yardımınızla birlikte  bu yıl sonunda sahneye koyacağımız müzikal 4. Gösterimiz olacak ve sayenizde bugüne kadar olanlardan çok daha etkileyici olacak.Her şekilde müzikal ve sanat kültürünü çevremizde yayarak, toplumumuza katkıda bulunuyoruz. Aslında siz de bağış yaparak topluluğumuzun bir parçası haline geliyorsunuz! Teşekkür ederiz!!Eğer gerçekten yardım etmek istiyorsanız ama mümkün değilse, sosyal medyadan kampanyamızı paylaşarak da destek olabilirsiniz!Bağışlarınız karşılığında size hediyelerimiz olacak!Teşekkür Mektubu!5 Dolar bağışlarsanız,  e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu göndereceğiz.Teşekkür Videosu!10 Dolar bağışlarsanız, e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu ile birlikte şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu göndereceğiz. Böylelikle yüzlerimizi görecek ve seslerimizi duyacaksınız!İstediğiniz Kişi İçin Doğumgünü Şarkısı Videosu!30 Dolar bağışlarsanız, e-posta adresinize, şahsınıza yazılmış içten bir teşekkür mektubu ile birlikte şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu göndereceğiz. Buna ek olarak , müzikal grubumuz tarafından istediğiniz kişi adına özel olarak doğum günü şarkısı videosu hazırlayıp göndereceğiz.  Bu muhteşem bir hediye, biz bağış yapabilseydik, kesinlikle bu hediyeyi tercih ederdik.İsminiz  Altın Harflerle Oyun Programımızda!50 Dolar bağışlarsanız, adınız oyun programımızda sponsor olarak yer alacak ve oyun fotoğrafları ile birlikte e-mail adresinize gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte. Meşhur olacaksınız! Oyun Programı ve Herşey!75 Dolar bağışlarsanız, müzikal grubumuz tarafından istediğiniz kişi adına özel olarak doğum günü şarkısı videosu hazırlayıp göndereceğiz. Adınız oyun programımızda sponsor olarak yer alacak ve oyun fotoğrafları ile birlikte e-mail adresinize gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte!İsminiz ve Gösterimiz!100 Dolar bağışlarsanız isminiz oyun programımızda altın harflerle  sponsor olarak yer alacak. Aynı zamanda gösteri videomuzun  linki , gösterimizi takiben sadece size özel bir şifre ile tarafınıza gönderilecek. Tabii ki  teşekkür mektubumuz ve şahsınız için özel olarak hazırlanan teşekkür videosu  ile birlikte!  Mükemmel değil mi?Sizin Etkinliğiniz ve Bizim Orkestramız!600 Dolar bağışlarsanız, orkestramız seyahat masraflarını karşılamanız ve üç hafta öncesinde bilgilendirmeniz durumunda  dilediğiniz bir etkinliğinizde sahne alacaktır. Ses sistemi sizin sorumluluğunuzda olacaktır. Bu iyi bir teklif değilse, nedir?

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Lauren Scott. I am currently a junior at Colorado State University studying Theater and Business. Last year I had the amazing opportunity of being cast in CSU's production of Alice in Wonderland. It was an immensely fulfilling experience I won't soon forget. I played the role of The Duchess and was nominated for an Irene Ryan award through the Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival. What does this mean? It means that on February 17th I get the opportunity to head to Ellensburg, Washington where this year's festival is being held to compete for this amazing scholarship and honor as well as network with potential future employers. The audition process for the Irene Ryan is to perform a monologue and, with a scene partner, perform two contrasting scenes. I have chosen the immensely talented Mason Weiss to be my scene partner. Both of us have already been working extensively to find the perfect scenes to work on for the next two months. But, we can not get out to Washington for this spectacular opportunity without your help. With your contributions and help in sharing what we are trying to achieve out in Washington, Mason and I will be able to afford travel costs (flight and bus) as well as the cost of the hotel for the week and the registration cost of the festival. Please help us take advantage of this unmatched opportunity to follow our dreams of working in this impeccable industry that is theater!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is an extremely rough estimation, per person, of what kind of funding we need and where it will go:

Flight: $400 (round trip)

Shuttle: $80 (round trip)

Hotel: $150

Festival registration: $83

If all of this is exactly correct, which at this point it is not the exact costs but very good estimates, we are looking at $713 for Mason and $713 for me, Lauren. 

But, it is not all about us. We appreciate all the help and support each and everyone one of you are willing to give us whether that is sharing our campaign with friends, contributing $1, or anything else. So, we have come up with some very special perks just for you:

1) If you can contribute just $5, not only will you being helping us on our journey to Washington, but you will also receive a personalized "thank you" from Mason and I.

2) If you can contribute $20, you can receive a digital diary of pictures from our time in Washington.

We appreciate all of you and the time you are willing to give our campaign!

The Impact

Theater is something that can be enjoyed by all and can create some very special conversations that nothing else can. Mason and I want to be able to pursue our goal of performing, something we each have a deep passion for. This is one of the greatest opportunities we will have to get our names out there and further our theater training with other students and faculty from across our region. 

This will also have an immense impact on how people perceive theater in Colorado. Our university has a growing, outstanding program that we want to be able to showcase to others. This opportunity will also prove that Colorado, and Fort Collins specifically, has some amazing talent. This trip could have the potential of bringing light to all this university and community has to offer. 

Risks & Challenges

This scholarship is extremely competitive and requires quite a large amount of time and energy. However, Mason and I are more than ready to soak up all the opportunities and learning experiences we will surely gain from this experience. Like I briefly mentioned earlier, we have already taken steps to find the ideal scenes to show off all our talent. We have also set up meetings with faculty and a showcase to be performed in January for us and our fellow CSU nominees to get feedback on our work. Overall, we are going into this adventure with positive attitudes and excitement to just have a fun, fulfilling experience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As college students, we understand that sometimes it is not realistic to contribute monetarily to things you are passionate about. And that is okay! Help us get the word out through your own personal group of friends, family, and colleagues. Use Facebook, Twitter, or any other form of communication to get the word out about our campaign. We hope that you believe in and can support our goal to get out to Ellensburg, Washington for the Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival in any way you can!

story:
About Me

Jeff Kirkman III is from Cleveland, Ohio. Currently, a B.F.A Candidate in Theatre Arts with a Concentration in Acting at Howard University (2013). I’ve grown personally and artistically since entering in Fall 2009, experiencing tremendous success and receiving confirmation that I will impact the world for the better in this field. I’ve faced many challenges that have aided my growth and development.

However, my experiences with Classical works are extremely limited; therefore, I decided to take a HUGE risk and a leap of faith by auditioning for a summer intensive.

On March 7,2012, I auditioned for, and as a result, have been invited to attend the British American and Drama Academy (BADA) as of March 21, 2012. The program is in association with the Yale School of Drama and UCLA. I’m EXTREMELY excited about this opportunity to immerse myself in a program that concentrates on classical Acting with an emphasis on Shakespeare.

What I Need

The Total costs of the opportunity will cost roughly $10,000.00!

The Breakdown is as follows:

Tuition and Fees - $7,000.00*

Airfare - $1,200.00 - $1,500.00*

Additional Money - $1,200.00 - $1,500.00*

*= Approximate costs associated with the program.

Please note:

  • Weekend Meals and Transportation aren’t included in the program tuition and fees.
  • Also, the 2012 Olympics in London run for the duration of the program; therefore, prices are sure to skyrocket due to the demand.

The Impact

  • Taking advantage of this opportunity will help me grow as an artist and will increase my confidence as an Actor.
  • It will allow me to see the world and get a small taste of graduate level training.
  • I plan to get my M.F.A., this gives me the ability to teach and give back on the college level and beyond!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help financially (or even if you can), Please SPREAD the Word:

  • Please POST this link to your Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • Email to anyone that may be open to helping with this cause.
  • Contact anybody looking to use this as a tax write-off!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools located on this page for ease of use!

story:
Our Story

We are a tiny high school theatre troupe trying to put on a show that won't bust the budget.  Unfortunately, due to time constraints, budget issues and many other events, we don't have a band or the money for a band.  We are trying to raise enough funds to cover the cost of the computer program to run it for us.

The Impact

The production really is for the students.  They get the chance to perform or help backstage and become part of a real production.  If we don't raise enough funds, it will be next to impossible to run a similar program for the students next year. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $2500 dollars to cover the cost of the computer program for a band as well as some of the performance rights.  The school is helping with the cost of set, location, costumes, props, etc.  Without this money, we will be in the hole and have to try other fundraising methods to recover the lost funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out!  The show is on Dec 7 and 8 at the Norman Rothstein Theatre in Vancouver.  The kids want to play to full houses (and ticket sales will help with the cost as well).  Tickets are $12 for adults and $10 for students.

story:
The City of Dallas is building a five-stack highway over Lucille’s childhood home… and her brother Percy is involved!

Our play is part of the New York International Fringe Festival. We had a few mishaps and began much later than we should have.

We are at the end of this process – and need to raise money to put this play on the stage.

The cast and director have worked tremendously hard on this project and it would be pretty disappointing not to be able to continue with their honorariums.

We have definitely learned many lessons from working on this project. There is no backing out – our only option is to forge ahead.

Everyone working on this project has practically donated their time – it is amazing, but we cannot allow the actor and director’s time to be donated.

high five synopsis:
When all of her neighbors sell their homes to wealthy land developers, Lucille Lee Baxter proves to the be the last woman standing, refusing to leave her neighborhood even when a five- level stack highway interchange has taken the place of it. Her protest causes turmoil with her brother, who works for the City of Dallas, and who is also trying to remove Lucille from their childhood home. Flashback 38 years to when the young siblings first move into the neighborhood. As both sister and brother try to adjust to their new environment, they are haunted by several racially- charged violent events from their immediate past.

story:
Short Summary

Introducing Us...

This is a play based on our story. We are husband and wife team, Craig and Shelly. We weren't always husband and wife, in fact, for most of our  story we weren't even together... cue pivotal plot moment in the form of surprise parenthood, and that's where And Then There Were 3 kicks off. Two new parents struggling hilariously to find themselves, their identities and battle through the mind field that is parenthood. Our story started where the play does, 7 years ago and being theatre makers we got to the point of wanting to share it.


Why we want to do this...

What started as a comic review, progressed into more of a vessel for us. A vessel to share our story,  to admit that parenting can be ridiculously hard, to shed light on the fact that dad's get Post Natal Depression too,  and a way for us to help other parents realise that they are not alone.  Parenting isn't always easy, kids don't come with instruction manuals, and if you are up the creek like we were, here's our way of handing you a paddle. Not a paddle in the form of answers, but one that shows others have been there before. The show also has a very resounding through line about always following your dreams. Getting this play up and running professionally is one of ours...  Of course we also like to laugh... a lot... so we threw in a ninja!


What you will help us achieve...

Our goal is to have this show touring nationally and then internationally. The money raised from this campaign will help us produce the premiere performance of And Then There Were 3 in Canberra Australia, as the first step in our goal towards taking this story all over the world. If we get the full amount we will be able to produce this first production in a fully professional capacity, pay all our cast and creatives properly and through its first few performances hopefully soothe some parents, inspire others and of course; laugh the socks off hundreds of unsuspecting theatre goers.

What We Need & What You Get

Where will the money go?

If we raise $10,000, it will cover the bare minimum production cost. The set, the sound and the lighting.... this means no one working on the project gets paid (or if they do it comes from our considerably empty pockets (and there is only so far lint goes!).)

If we raise $25,000, the extra $15 grand goes to paying our production artists reasonable fees to deliver the project - this means our musician, to create original music for the show,(and he's awesome and talented!) a designer for the set, costumes, props and puppet, and a lighting designer...

The full $45,000 would cover all the above plus our actors to rehearse and perform the show (which at equity rates is approx $4500 each), give us some money toward publicity,  cover a directors fee and also cover the cost of a much needed babysitter so we can actually rehearse the show!

Obviously if we don't raise the full amount, we will make sure our artists get paid first (at least something) and we will find money to feed the kids elsewhere... (Yes imagine mini violin playing in the background)...

What you can get...

The most intangible but important reward you will get by supporting this show is the satisfaction of knowing you have; helped other parents feel identified, supported and connected; inspired people to find their own identities and follow their dreams; and of course you are supporting artists, acknowledging their creative contributions deserve remuneration. You will also be one of the first people to support a production that has the potential to be the next big thing!

The Perks

Ever wanted to be an executive producer? Get a preview of a new show before anyone else? Send advice from a precocious Mother In Law to a friend or acquaintance? Have a Skype conversation with a whisky drinking baby puppet, meet the cast and crew to a show, or have them record a thank you message especially for you?... Have a look at all the perks we offer and find the one right for you! 

The Impact

Supporting this project means; supporting and creating a voice for parents, raising awareness of Paternal Post Natal Depression, supporting talented artists, bringing joy and laughter to hundreds of theatre goers and believing in a world where we all have the ability to craft our own paths and create our dreams...

Craig and I have a long history in theatre, co founding our own theatre company in 2002 and producing over 20 productions. We wrote our first show (The Toilet Monologues) together 8 years ago, with a couple of kids shows written in between, and have come together now to create 3, which is easily the best work we have created together - helped greatly by the professional dramaturgy of Peter Matherson (Dramaturg credits include: Sydney Theatre Company, Melbourne Theatre Company, La Boite and Australian Council for the Arts.) It's raw, it's real, it's honest - and it is incredibly funny!

We really feel that this story has 'legs' and the ability to touch many people. We just need your help in these first stages to get it up and off the ground running! A great premiere production will mean hugely increasing our chances of being picked up for a national tour and this show reaching more  people and going further than a tiny studio theatre season. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute by giving us money, that's okay - you can still help.

Go like our page www.facebook.com/thentherewere3 and share with your friends. Have a look at our website www.andthentherewere3.com and tell other people to do the same. Book your ticket to see the show at https://www.patronbase.com/_ST/Productions/ATT3/Performances, Or share this campaign directly by using the Indiegogo share tools! Any one person you tell will help us get that little bit closer to our goal!!!

We really appreciate you reading this far and hope you can support us in our campaign!

If we raise $10,000, it will cover the bare minimum production cost. The set, the sound and the lighting.... this means no one working on the project gets paid (or if they do it comes from our considerably empty pockets (and there is only so far lint goes!).)
If we raise $25,000, the extra $15 grand goes to paying our production artists reasonable fees to deliver the project - this means our musician, to create original music for the show,(and he's awesome and talented!) a designer for the set, costumes, props and puppet, and a lighting designer... 
The full $45,000 would cover all the above plus our actors to rehearse and perform the show (which at equity rates is approx $4500 each), give us some money toward publicity,  cover a directors fee and also cover the cost of a much needed babysitter so we can actually rehearse the show!
Obviously if we don't raise the full amount, we will make sure our artists get paid first (at least something) and we will find money to feed the kids elsewhere... (Yes imagine mini violin playing in the background)...
What you can get...
The most intangible but important reward you will get by supporting this show is the satisfaction of knowing you have; helped other parents feel identified, supported and connected; inspired people to find their own identities and follow their dreams; and of course you are supporting artists, acknowledging their creative contributions deserve remuneration. You will also be one of the first people to support a production that has the potential to be the next big thing!
The PerksEver wanted to be an executive producer? Get a preview of a new show before anyone else? Send advice from a precocious Mother In Law to a friend or acquaintance? Have a Skype conversation with a whisky drinking baby puppet, meet the cast and crew to a show, or have them record a thank you message especially for you?... Have a look at all the perks we offer and find the one right for you! 


The Impact
Supporting this project means; supporting and creating a voice for parents, raising awareness of Paternal Post Natal Depression, supporting talented artists, bringing joy and laughter to hundreds of theatre goers and believing in a world where we all have the ability to craft our own paths and create our dreams...
Craig and I have a long history in theatre, co founding our own theatre company in 2002 and producing over 20 productions. We wrote our first show (The Toilet Monologues) together 8 years ago, with a couple of kids shows written in between, and have come together now to create 3, which is easily the best work we have created together - helped greatly by the professional dramaturgy of Peter Matherson (Dramaturg credits include: Sydney Theatre Company, Melbourne Theatre Company, La Boite and Australian Council for the Arts.) It's raw, it's real, it's honest - and it is incredibly funny!
We really feel that this story has 'legs' and the ability to touch many people. We just need your help in these first stages to get it up and off the ground running! A great premiere production will mean hugely increasing our chances of being picked up for a national tour and this show reaching more  people and going further than a tiny studio theatre season. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute by giving us money, that's okay - you can still help. 
Go like our page www.facebook.com/thentherewere3 and share with your friends. Have a look at our website www.andthentherewere3.com and tell other people to do the same. Book your ticket to see the show at https://www.patronbase.com/_ST/Productions/ATT3/Performances, Or share this campaign directly by using the Indiegogo share tools! Any one person you tell will help us get that little bit closer to our goal!!! 
We really appreciate you reading this far and hope you can support us in our campaign!

story:
My name is Ashley Malloy and I am a senior at Central Connecticut State University pursuing a BFA degree in theatre performance.

This summer, I am producing and performing in the one woman show, My Name is Rachel Corrie. This impactful piece chronicles Rachel's journey from her home in Olympia, WA to the Gaza Strip, where she discovers her purpose in life through the International Solidarity Movement and develops a deeper humanitarian and political consciousness. The play is comprised exclusively of Rachel's writings, and takes us up to the fateful moment of Rachel's death. 

Rachel Corrie planted herself in the path of an Israeli bulldozer that was aiming to demolish a Palestinian family's home. Although she was completely visible to the driver, Rachel's body was crushed, and she died only moments after. She is an icon in the Palestinian community, representing an enduring hope and indomitable spirit, elements which fuel the non-violent resistance she practiced and preached.

I am taking this project on as an actor looking to grow as an artist, as well as an ally of Palestine who believes in the power of creative resistance against the occupation.

ALL funds raised from the production will go directly to The Freedom Theatre in the Jenin refugee camp. This theatre redirects young people's  violent inclinations towards the Israeli occupation by equipping them with artistic skills they can use as their new tools of resistance. 

Since the theatre was founded by actor Juliano Mer-Khamis in 2006, dozens of young men and women have found a safe haven where they can express themselves without limitations they are usually presented with in their day to day lives. Actors of the Freedom Theatre have ventured to the US where they have met such luminaries as Tony Kushner and Paula Vogel. Their work has been featured at the New York Theatre Workshop, where their production of The Island by Athol Fugard will run for a limited time this September. You can learn more about the Freedom Theatre at the link below:

http://www.thefreedomtheatre.org/

Your donations will go towards costumes, props, printing programs, and other details that are integral to the production. Any extra funds will go directly to the Freedom Theatre to add to money raised from the production. Please donate whatever you can comfortably provide. And know that your generosity is empowering the creative cultural resistance of Palestinian youth by bringing Rachel Corrie's story to life.

If you would prefer to give to the theatre directly, you can do so at the link below:

http://www.thefreedomtheatre.org/join-us/make-a-donation/ 

My Name is Rachel Corrie will be performed September 5th, 6th, and 7th at 7:30 in Davidson Hall, room 123 at Central Connecticut State University. There is a suggested donation of $5.00. The show runs approximately 70 minutes, and there is no intermission.

For more information on this production of My Name is Rachel Corrie as a benefit for the Freedom Theatre of Jenin, please feel free to contact me at ash.malloy@my.ccsu.edu

story:
Arts Alliance presents Urinetown!

Arts Alliance is the oldest and largest student arts group at Northwestern University. It is a non-profit organization founded by a collection of groups looking to share space, and has grown to become one of the largest student arts organizations in the country. Its annual season consists of four mainstage shows including The Dolphin Show, America's Largest Student Produced Musical, and the management of three Satellite groups: Thunk A Cappella, Graffiti Dancers, and Mee-Ow Improv & Sketch Comedy.

Arts Alliance’s primary goal is to provide diverse, accessible, and fulfilling artistic experiences to enrich students from all different parts of the Northwestern University community. Arts Alliance is rooted in its long-standing traditions and continues to seek out new artistic opportunities. It provides a positive atmosphere in which students can learn and work alongside a supportive board to create exciting, professional-quality productions.

This year, Arts Alliance is proud to present Urinetown: The Musical as its early fall show.  Urinetown satirizes capitalism, populism and legal system in general, but it also parodies other Broadway classics.  The musical takes place in a town where the public amenities are run by the government and the citizens must pay in order to use the bathroom.  Urinetown asks audience members to laugh, to cry and to take a second look—whether that be at our government or conventional musical structures. 

Book by Greg Kotis

Music by Mark Hollmann

Lyrics by Mark Hollmann and Greg Kotis

Production Team

Produced by Sally Lindel

Directed by Garrett Baer

Cast

Bobby Strong: Graham Duff
Hope Cladwell: Grace Kennedy
Caldwell B. Cladwell: Matt Kestenbaum
Ms. McQueen: Juli Del Prete
Penelope Pennywise: Lauren Lenke
Officer Lockstock: Scott Wolf
Officer Barrel: Alex Bird
Little Sally: Isabel Thompson
Josephine "Ma" Strong/Others: Phoebe Gonzalez
Joseph "Old Man" Strong/Others: Liam McShane
Senator Fipp/Others: Justine Gelfman
Hot Blades Harry/Others: Will Wilhelm
Little Becky Two Shoes/Others: Eva Victor
Soupy Sue/Others: Rosemarie Chandler

Rehearsal Team
Stage Manager: Kyle Largent
Music Director: Conor Keelan
Choreographer: Hillary Aarons
Assistant Choreographer: Amelia Bell

Artistic Team
Set Designer: Joseph Entenman
Costume Designer: Emily Martin
Assistant Costume Designer: Mahek Tulsiani
Hair & Makeup Designer: Talia Weingarten
Assistant Hair & Makeup Designer: Daniel Bender Stern
Sound Designer: Matt Kania
Lighting Designer: Aaron Lorenz
Master Electrician: Stephanie Kahn
Technical Director: Alex Shaffer

What We Need & What You Will Get

Funding a project of this scale is not easy. We need financial support to help make the visions of our director and all of our designers come to life, and to publicize this incredible performance. Your donation money will go to:

·  Building a set that will transform Shanely Pavilion into Amenity #9

·  Funding the lights, costumes and props

·  Publicizing this event

The Impact

Urinetown is one of the first plays of the school year, and so it is especially geared toward making freshmen aware and excited about the theatre on Northwestern’s campus.  We want to inspire freshmen—whether they are theatre majors or not—to take advantage of the amazing opportunities Northwestern theatre has to offer.  Whether that be continuing to see shows on campus throughout the year, auditioning, or working on a production team, we want to encourage students to continue to have a connection to the theatre community at Northwestern and beyond. 

From the perspective of future audience members, we hope that their reaction walking away after the show includes not only a respect for and enjoyment of theatre, but also a conscious response to the demographic diversity of the audience.  We hope that the theatre is filled with a wide range of people from different parts of campus, including people of many majors, ethnicities, and ages.  We hope these people feel excited and empowered to discuss the show with each other and to carry its message and their experience with them after they leave the theatre.

Above all else we hope to bring the joy of theatre to the Northwestern community.  For us, this can only be accomplished if we can make Urinetown accessible to all parts of campus, with a focus on freshmen and non-theatre majors.  The theatre community at Northwestern has so much to offer, and whether incoming students apply as theatre majors, or simply just enjoy seeing shows, their participation perpetuates that joy of theatre. We hope that our production of Urinetown builds on the appreciation and love for theatre that already exists on Northwestern’s campus by motivating new theatre goers to experience more theatre and old theatre lovers to see their craft in a different light.

story:
About Inclined Dance Project...

Inclined Dance Project began in January 2009 as informal rehearsals between director Kristen Klein and her friend's and fellow dance colleagues from The Boston Conservatory. Initially started as a way to experiment with movement and various choreographic exploits, these experimental rehearsals eventually took shape leading Kristen Klein to found Inclined Dance Project, with the company premiering in July 2009. 

Our 2013 Company Dancers include: Amy Campbell, Christina Chelette, Chie Mukai, Morgana Phlaum, Jennifer Radcliffe, and Lucy Stack.

Inclined Dance Project is now in it's 4th year of making work, but in those 4 years we have yet to produce our own individual season. The company has toured and performed Kristen Klein's work through the platforms of Festivals, Showcases, and Split-Bills, building our audience and expanding the company's repertoire. Since 2009 we have created over 12 original works, and we are currently working on completing our very first full length work Stuck Together Pieces (which will be another milestone for IDP!). We'll be self-producing our very own weekend of performances this Fall and premiering the completed Stuck Together Pieces in November. And we need your help!


Help Support Our Dream...

Being a small, independent dance company in NYC is tough business. For the past 4 years, ALL of the company's expenses have been covered by Artistic Director Kristen Klein from her own funds. This means a lot of part-time jobs, a lot of budgeting, and a lot of serious planning on her part! Rehearsal space, venue costs, costumes, dancer compensation, music fees, video/photography costs...it all adds up. In order to produce our first Inclined Season we need a bit more than Kristen's pocket change to put on the best show we can. That's where you come in! With your support, we can make the following dreams come true:

  • The successful production of Inclined's first Independent Season at the Center for Performance Research. No more split-bills, no more festivals...just a full weekend showcasing Inclined's amazing dancers and Kristen Klein's choreography. Its been 4 years of waiting and planning...help us make this happen!

  • The completion of our first full length work, Stuck Together Pieces. This piece has been almost a full year in the making! Focusing on improvisation combined with set choreography, the piece targets the themes of connecting, re-connecting, and disconnecting among human beings. The piece has been presented in partial segments at workshops and venues throughout 2012-2013 including The Muse, The Sgorous Theater, and The Flea Theater. The completed work will be premiering at the Center for Performance Research in November 2013.


Your Donation...

Your generous donations will help Inclined in a multitude of ways! We need to raise at least $2500 to help cover the costs of:

  • Dancer Pay
  • Venue Rental @The Center for Performance Research
  • Event Insurance
  • Rehearsal Rentals to complete Stuck Together Pieces

All donations are processed through our Fiscal Sponsor Fractured Atlas, and are fully tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. 

In return, we have some awesome thankyous and gifts for our campaign supporters!


Other Ways You Can Help

First of all, thank you for even taking a look at our campaign and our company! We understand that things are tight for everyone these days, so if you can't contribute at this time: we understand! You can help us in other ways. :)

- Spread the word about our campaign! Share our link with your friends, family, dancers, fellow art lovers...the more people check us out, the better!

- Come to our show! No matter what happens with the campaign, we still plan on finding a way to present our Fall Season. Join us at The Center for Performance Research: November 15 & 16, 2013. 

- Like us on Facebook!  or visit our Website.

- Join our email list! Send an email to: inclineddp@gmail.com requesting to join our eblast and stay up to date on all of Inclined's amazing happenings.

- Send us happy vibes. Virtual high-fives. Or hugs. We love hugs.

Thankyou for reading, watching, and most of all for supporting our goal. You are helping us keep art, dance, and live performance thriving!

story:
Why?

  • Portland deserves a great, cool, quirky, fun, and professional unscripted theatre troupe, and they finally have one.  We are The Unscriptables, and we present long-form unscripted shows in a variety of genres.  The founders, Andy Barrett and Trenton Shine, have been working together for 20 years, writing, directing, producing, and performing.  Our dedicated and talented cast helps us bring the audience a unique, entertaining, and satisfying theatre experience.

Campaign Summary

  • We are launching this campaign to raise funds for our 2013-2014 season.  We really want to raise the bar this year, and as with all ambitious projects, money is usually a factor.  With adequate funding, we can bring to life shows that we've talked about for years.  We are always striving to push the envelope creatively, to create that "wow" factor our audience has come to expect.  This can't be done without the help of many people.  That's where you, our supporters, come in.

2013-2014 Season

  • With your donations, our 2013-14 season will be our best yet.  Planned shows include: "Big Brother League", a superhero reality show performed live on stage.  "Steampunk Mysteries", a Victorian era adventure, and "Murder Mystery Machine" (think Scooby Doo meets Saw).  Launching these shows will require some sizable resources.  There's lots of costumes, props, makeup, and even a custom-built lifesize Scooby Doo puppet.  With your help, we can make all this happen. 

Our Needs

  • We are seeking $2500 to cover these costs.  This would set us up to get everything we need, and allow us to focus on the creative side, bringing you the quality you've come to expect from The Unscriptables.  If we surpass our goal (which would be awesome), we can look towards upgrading our lighting and sound system, and even setting ourselves up to be able to run live shows online.

Your Rewards

  • And by donating, you will bag yourself some sweet perks.  Here's a list of our donor levels and the thank-you gifts that come with them: Look to your Right

Final Thoughts

  • We have been doing this for a long time.  To any of you who have seen us, you know we don't do anything unless we can do it right.  And these contributions would help us realize shows that we've only imagined performing up until now.
 
 
 
And if you are in no position to give money, it doesn't mean you can't still contribute.  As a friend of the Unscriptables, you can pass the word on to others. Indiegogo has many share tools available to help you share our vision with your friends. 
 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
(French and German will follow)

If I were to express my message, it would be my lack thereof. I don't want to say anything. I am not a politician, nor a priest, nor publicist, nor pundit. I want to liberate theater from all its purported missions, to let it be itself, all by itself. What I have are images, sensations, texts which affect me, music which makes me tremble. With these elements, we will attack the stage, allowing them to confront the necessary criterion of all theater: space.

Beyond these elements, I neither have nor want more. I want to keep open all possibilities of meaning, so that from this confrontation can be born unexpectable semantic links and connections. My intention is not intentional. If theater is to be autonomous, it should work in an autonomous manner, without being beholden to the text, the message, or any other element which is not properly theatrical. Everything will be constructed out of this confrontation, this clash between space and sense. The result, we could say with Deleuze, will be percepts.

This work will be a theatrical, performative research. To allow for this confrontation of sense and space, without teleology or a priori expectations, will demand much of the actors : great patience, generosity and productive power. The actors themselves, then, will take part in the creation of the work. It is not, then, about a director's imposition: the result will be, rather, a collective creation. I will not take the position of the subject of supposed knowledge. I would like to open a space of insecurity, doubt, ignorance, without the need to perform as the one who knows. The work will be without a master. It will be a process that will be thought, proposed, and performed by ourselves.

About the aesthetic we will be searching for: I consider that naturalism remains our biggest enemy. Let us search for abstraction in theater. Let us search for defiguration, for transfiguration. Let us go there with force. Let us strive beyond ourselves.

The actors will have to give themselves over with both body and soul, risking in this uncertain space their “mental health,” approaching the very limits of madness. Everything will be done without compromise. It is only here where we can find our creative power.

I'm not afraid of human pathos. A non-pathetic pathos.

About me: Born in Germany, I spent 5 years in Montreal, Canada. I studied psychology, and finished a bachelor's degree in France. It was in France that my discovery of theater changed the direction of my life. Since then, all my decisions have been directed towards theater and towards the possibility of free creation. I began by acting, but quickly came to the mise en scène. Last year I staged Le songe ou un jeu de rêve(“A dream play”) by A.Strindberg, interspersed with texts by Dostoyevsky, Rilke, Lautréamont, Baudelaire and others. This prior work was for me a sort of stylistic prefiguration, taking the form of a theatrical construction site: http://theatre-vitez.com/2012/05/festival-3-jours-et-plus-4/

By contributing to this project, you will help young creators realize their fundamental need: production, a production freed from the alienation of monetary exigencies. At the same time, you will help to defend a free theater, a theater which is absolutely necessary, a theater which is political without committing itself to a 'political message'. It is the variation around the standard (to again borrow the words of Deleuze).

Though this will not cost a great deal, there are costs involved. Here is a prognostic budget:

 

Expenses

 

Costumes

150,00 €

Accessories

150,00 €

Paint

30,00 €

Transport

100,00 €

Rehearsal space, rent for 40 days

1000,00 €

Printing

50,00 €

TOTAL

1480,00 €

As you can see, our largest expense will be the renting of a stage for rehearsal. At the time of writing, we are looking for spaces which will allow us to work for free. In general, however, our only options are cooperative organizations which are also short on funding, or spaces in which it is only possible to work for a very short time once a week. For our project, such conditions will not suffice. This would necessitate the exclusion of many theatrical elements, such as lighting, sound and stage design, due to logistical constraints. The rest of our budget is proof that we are making 'poor theater' (to borrow a term from Grotowski).In the event that some money remains after the completion of this project, it will be used for the second part of the diptych, Esquisse # 2: une ode, to be created by a larger team in the upcoming year.

What do you get for your contribution? Normally the first question in our capitalistic society. In fact, this is a hard question to answer when our 'product' is theater, because it is not a mechanically reproducible art form (which is, by the way, its beauty, its cruelty, its strength, its uniqueness). Of course you can get a free entrance to a show if you are in Marseille. If not you will at least get a postcard.

If you give a bit more, we will write about you. Yes! It's not a material compensation, but a personal one. A team of young men and women will write about you, perhaps on the other side of the world, and even if they don't know you at all. And if you give even a little more, we will send the texts to you.

If by chance giving is not a possibility, but you nevertheless are interested in the project we are working on, you can also share it with friends and family and spread the word.

If you have any questions, we would be happy to answer them. Don't hesitate. We will keep this site updated, and get a video of our next rehearsal session. The photos you are seeing come from our first three days of work.

Thank you for your interest,
M.S.

 

Materials and references at the end

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(German will follow)

Si je peux dire une chose, c'est que je ne veux et ne peux rien dire. Je n'ai pas de message à livrer. Je ne suis ni prêtre, ni politicien, ni publicitaire. Tout ce que j'ai, c'est des images, des sensations, des émotions, des textes qui me secouent, des musiques qui m'ébranlent, des expériences. C'est avec cela que j'irai sur le plateau. C'est ces images, sensations, émotions, textes, musiques, etc que je confronterai à un des critères définitionnels nécessaires du théâtre, c'est-à-dire à l'espace.

À part ces éléments, je n'aurai rien de plus. Je veux garder l'espace sémantique ouvert pour que cette confrontation des matériaux avec un espace (physique) donné puisse ouvrir des espaces sémantiques insoupçonnés. Ma démarche n'est justement pas intentionnelle, je n'ai pas dessiné un dessein. Mais si le théâtre veut devenir un jour un art autonome, il faudrait qu'il commence à travailler d'une manière autonome, c'est-à-dire ne plus rien devoir au texte, au message ou à tout autre élément secondaire. Rien n'est donné d'avance, tout est à construire! Le résultat, pourrait-on dire avec Deleuze, seront des percepts.

Il s'agira d'un réel travail de recherche. Confronter librement, sans à-priori, ouvertement, ces matériaux au plateau, demandera aux acteurs et actrices une patience, une générosité, une force de proposition. Il s'agira d'un réel travail de création de la part des acteurs/actrices. C'est dans ce sens qu'il s'agira d'une création quelque part collective. Je ne prendrai aucunement la position du savoir supposé. Je ne saurai pas, pas plus que n'importe qui d'autre. Je voudrais qu'on ouvre un espace d'insécurité, de doute, de non-savoir sans que je sois obligé de jouer le rôle de celui qui sait. En d'autres mots, j'aimerais arriver à une existence de travail théâtral sans maître, que nous pensions, agissions et créions par nous-mêmes.

Pour ce qui est de l'esthétique que j'aimerais rechercher, je considère que le naturalisme demeure l'ennemi absolu. Cherchons l'abstraction au théâtre. Cherchons la défiguration. Mais allons y avec puissance. Allons au delà de nous-mêmes. Les acteurs devront se plonger corps et âme dans cette espace incertain, au risque de leur santé mental, se promenant sur la limite de la folie. Chaque proposition de jeu doit être sans retenue, au risque de tout, sans compromis; et ce serait là dedans qu'on trouvera un plaisir et une réelle puissance.

N'ayons pas peur du pathos humain. D'un pathos non-pathétique.

Un mot sur moi : né en Allemagne, j'ai vécu cinq ans à Montréal (Québec), Canada. J'y ai commencé à étudier la psychologie et j'ai terminé ma licence 3 en France. Durant cette année, j'ai découvert le théâtre et rien de moins que le sens de ma vie. Depuis-lors, tous mes choix sont dirigés vers le théâtre et une possibilité de créer librement. Je suis entré au théâtre en jouant, mais j'ai touché rapidement à la mise en scène. L'année dernière, j'ai mis en scène Le songe ou un jeu de rêve d'August Strindberg intercallé avec des textes de Dostoïevski, Rilke, Lautréamont, Baudelaire et autres. Ce travail préfigurait alors ce présent projet en tant qu'il s'agissait d'une mise en place d'un vaste chantier théâtral: http://theatre-vitez.com/2012/05/festival-3-jours-et-plus-4/

En contribuant à ce projet, vous aidez des jeunes créateurs à pouvoir travailler et donc à réaliser leur nécessité; et dans ce cas, à défendre un théâtre libre, un théâtre qui croit qu'il est crucial, qu'il est absolument nécessaire dans notre société, un théâtre qui est profondément politique même en ne l'étant pas explicitement, qui est une variation autour de l'étendard standard (en parlant encore une fois avec des termes deleuzien).

Même si cela n'a pas un prix exorbitant, cela coûte quelque chose. Voici un budget prévisionnel :

Dépenses

 

Costumes

150,00 €

Accessoires

150,00 €

Maquillage

30,00 €

Transports

100,00 €

Résidences, loyer pour 40 jours

1000,00 €

Impressions

50,00 €

TOTAL

1480,00 €

Comme vous pouvez le voir, le plus grand montant va au loyer d'une scène où nous pouvons répéter. Nous sommes, bien entendu, aussi à la recherche des locaux qui pourraient nous être prêtés gratuitement, mais la plupart du temps, il s'agit de locaux associatifs et alternatifs qui soit demandent, eux aussi, dû à leur situation, une participation financière, soit offre une possibilité de répéter un temps court une fois par semaine par exemple. Je considère que ce ne sont pas des conditions possibles pour le travail que nous voulons délivrer, car ceci demande d'exclure des éléments théâtraux comme la lumière, le son ou la scénographie du processus de création. Le reste dans le budget montre que nous faisons du réel théâtre pauvre (Grotowski). Si jamais il devrait y avoir un surplus d'argent, celui-ci ira directement dans la création de la seconde partie du diptyque Esquisse # 2 : une ode, laquelle sera créé l'année prochaine avec une plus grande équipe.

Que recevez-vous pour votre contribution? (Normalement, la première question dans notre système capitaliste.) En fait, il n'est pas facile d'y répondre lorsque notre produit final est du théâtre considérant qu'il s'agit d'un art techniquement non reproductible (ce qui fait, d'ailleurs, sa beauté, sa cruauté, sa force et son unicité). Bien sûr vous recevrez une invitation à une représentation si vous êtes dans le coin. Sinon, nous vous enverrons au moins une carte postale. Si vous donnez un peu plus, nous écrivons sur vous. Oui! Il ne s'agit pas d'une récompense matérialiste, mais plutôt mentale, spirituelle. Une équipe de jeunes hommes et femmes écrivent sur vous, peut-être à l'autre bout du monde, s'ils vous connaissent ou non. Si vous donnez encore un peu plus, nous vous enverrons une lettre avec ces écrits.

Si jamais vous ne pouvez donner de l'argent, mais que vous appréciez le projet que nous proposons, vous pouvez partager l'information avec vos ami(e)s et votre famille et faire passer le mot.

Si vous avez quelconques questions, nous serions heureux de vous répondre. N'hésitez surtout pas. Nous essayerons de tenir ce site à jour et y mettre un vidéo des prochaines répétitions. Les photos que vous voyez viennent de nos premiers trois jours de travail.

Merci beaucoup de votre intérêt,

M.S.

 

Matériaux et Références voir en bas.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wenn ich etwas sagen kann, dann dass ich nichts sagen kann und nichts sagen will. Ich habe keine Nachricht. Ich bin weder Politiker, noch Priester, noch ein Publizist oder Werbedienst. Ich will das Theater von allen seinen Missionen befreien, und es an und für sich gelten lassen. Alles was ich habe sind Bilder, Wahrnehmungen, Texte, die mich bewegen, Musik, die mich erschüttert, Erfahrungen... Damit gehen wir auf die Bühne und konfrontieren sie mit dem notwendigen Kriterium des Theaters: Raum. Ich habe und will nicht mehr als diese Elemente, da ich den semantische Raum frei halten möchte, um aus der Konfrontation der genannten Materialien mit dem physischen Raum vollkommen unerhoffte semantische Zusammenhänge entstehen lassen zu können. Meine Absicht ist nicht beabsichtig, vorsätzlich oder absichtlich. Wenn das Theater endlich autonom werden will, sollte es auch autonom arbeiten, ohne dem Text, der Aussage, oder sonst irgendetwas Zweitrangigem etwas zu schulden. Nichts ist von vornherein gegeben, alles ist zu konstruieren! Das Resultat, könnte man mit Deleuze sagen, sind Perzepte.

Es handelt sich um eine wahrhaftige theatrale Forschungsarbeit. Diese Materialien frei, ohne a-priori, offen mit der Bühne zu konfrontieren erfordert von den Schauspielern Großzügigkeit, Geduld und Stärke in ihren künstlerischen Vorschlägen. Die Schauspieler müssen somit eine wahrhaftig kreative Arbeit leisten. Aus diesem Grund ist dieses Projekt in gewissen Maßen ein kollektives Schaffen. Ich werde keinesfalls die Position des vermuteten Wissenden einnehmen. Ich werde nicht wissen, nicht mehr und nicht weniger als jeder andere auch. Ich möchte einen Raum der Unsicherheit, des Zweifels, des Nicht-Wissens öffnen, ohne dass ich die Rolle desjenigen übernehme, der weiß. In anderen Worten, ich möchte zu einer theatralen Arbeit ohne Vorbild, Meister oder Führer gelangen, in der wir selbst und eigenständig denken, agieren und schaffen.

Die Ästhetik betreffend denke ich, dass der Naturalismus immer noch unser größter Feind ist und dies auch bleibt. Lasst uns nach Abstraktion im Theater forschen! Nach Entstellung! Nach Verwandlung! Aber lasst uns in die Arbeit mit Macht und Stärke gehen. Lasst uns über uns selbst hinaus gehen. Die Schauspieler werden sich mit Kopf und Seele in diesen unsicheren Raum werfen müssen, ihrer “Geistesgesundheit”wagend, auf der Grenze des Wahnsinns wandelnd. Jeder Vorschlag, jeder Akt auf der Bühne muss sich ohne Grenzen, ohne Kompromisse vollziehen, in der Gefahr vor allem; und nur dort werden wir die Kraft und die Macht, die wir suchen, finden können.

Ich habe keine Angst vor dem menschlichen Pathos. Einem nicht-pathetischen Pathos.

Ein kurzes Wort über mich: In Deutschland geboren, emigrierte ich für fünf Jahre nach Montreal, Kanada, wo ich anfing Psychologie zu studieren. Ich schloss meinen Bachelor in Frankreich ab. In diesem Jahr entdeckte ich das Theater und nichts weniger als den Sinn meines Lebens. Seit dem sind alle meine Entscheidungen auf das Theater und die Möglichkeit, irgendwie frei schaffen zu können, ausgerichtet. Ich bin als Schauspieler ins Theater gedrungen, aber arbeitete schnell in der Rolle des Regisseurs. Letztes Jahr inszenierte ich „Le songe ou un jeu de rêve“ („EinTraumspiel“) von August Strindberg, durchbrochen von Texten unterschiedlicher Autoren wie Dostojewski, Rilke, Lautréamont, Baudelaire u.a. Diese Arbeit erwies sich in dem Sinne als Präfiguration des jetzigen Projekts, als dass sich dort die Konzeption des Theaters als einer großen theatralen Baustelle herausgestellte hatte. (http://theatre-vitez.com/2012/05/festival-3-jours-et-plus-4/)

Indem sie dieses Projekt unterstützen, helfen Sie jungen Schaffenden daran zu arbeiten, das ihnen unbedingt Notwendige realisieren zu können, und in diesem konkreten Fall verteidigen sie ein freies Theater, ein Theater, das glaubt, dass es in unserer heutigen Gesellschaft absolut notwendig ist, ein Theater, das, wenn auch nicht explizit politisch, absolut politisch ist : Eine Variation des Standartmaßes (um noch einmal mit Deleuzes Worten zu sprechen).

Dies kostet, wenn auch nicht allzu viel, eine gewisse Summe. Hier ist ein Kostenvoranschlag:

Ausgaben

 

Kostüme

150,00 €

Accessoires

150,00 €

Maske

30,00 €

Transport

100,00 €

Probebühne, Miete für 40 Tage

1000,00 €

Druckkosten

50,00 €

TOTAL

1480,00 €

Wie sie sehen können, fliesst das grösste Budget in die Miete einer Probebühne. Wir versuchen selbstverständlich auch Räume zu finden, die uns umsonst geliehen werden, doch meistens handelt es sich um Vereine, die auch knapp bei Kasse sind, oder um Räume, die wir nur für eine kurze Zeit einmal wöchentlich haben könnten. Unter diesen Bedingungen halte ich jedoch die Arbeit, die wir leisten wollen, für unmöglich. Es würde bedeuten, sämtliche theatrale Elemente wie Licht, Ton und Bühnenbild aus dem kreativen Prozess aus logistischen Gründen ausschließen zu müssen.

Anhand der übrigen Kosten können Sie bemerken, dass wir ansonsten armes Theater(Grotowski) machen. Falls ein Teil des Geldes übrig bleiben sollte, wird es direkt in die Produktion des zweiten Teils des Dyptichons, Esquisse # 2: une ode, fließen. Esquisse # 2 werden wir nächstes Jahr mit einem größeren Team in Angriff nehmen.

Und was erhalten Sie für ihren finanziellen Beitrag? (Normalerweise immer die erste Frage in unserem kapitalistischen System.) Diese Frage ist gar nicht leicht zu beantworten, wenn unser „Endprodukt“ Theater, d.h. eine technisch nicht-reproduzierbare Kunstform, ist. Natürlich werden Sie eine Einladung zu einer Vorführung und freien Eintritt erhalten. Wenn Sie aber nicht in der Gegend sind, werden Sie zumindest eine Postkarte bekommen. Falls Sie ein wenig mehr geben können, werden wir über Sie schreiben. Es ist keine materielle Belohnung, aber eine geistige. Ein Team junger Männer und Frauen wird über Sie, ob bekannt oder nicht, vielleicht am anderen Ende der Welt, schreiben. Wenn Sie uns noch ein bisschen mehr unterstützen, werden wir Ihnen einen handschriftlichen Brief mit den verschiedenen Texten über Sie schicken.

Falls Sie uns nicht finanziell unterstützen können, aber unser Projekt trotzdem interessant finden, können sie diese Informationen gerne mit ihren Freundinnen und Freunden und ihrer Familie teilen.

Falls Sie irgendwelche Fragen haben sollten, zögern Sie nicht. Wir freuen uns Ihnen zu antworten. Wir werden versuchen, Sie über diese Seite auf dem Laufenden zu halten und ein Video unserer nächsten Probe hochzuladen. Die Photos, die schon zu sehen sind, stammen von unseren ersten drei Tagen Arbeit.

Besten Dank für ihr Interesse,
M.S.

 

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Matériaux et Références :

 

Bibliographie :

Heinrich Böll, Ansichten eines Clowns (La grimace)

Gilles Deleuze, Abécédaire

Fjodor Dostoïevski, Aufzeichnungen aus dem Kellerloch (Carnets du sous-sol)

Michel Foucault, Le Corps utopique, Les hétérotopies

Gombrowitcz, La pornographie

Klaus Kinski, Ich bin so wild dach deinem Erdbeermund

Fernando Pessoa, Le livre de l'Intranquillité

Marcel Proust, À la recherche du temps perdu

Reiner Maria Rilke, Le livre des images, Les cahiers de Malte Laurids Brigge, Duineser Elegien, Neue Gedichte, Le Livre d'heures, Die Weise von Liebe und Tod des Cornets Christoph Rilke, Lettres à un jeune poète

 

Musique :

Antonio Caldara, Maddalena ai piedi di Cristo, interprête : M.-C. Kiehr

Léo Ferré, Ne chantez pas la mort

Monteverdi, Lamento de la nimpha

Arvo Pärt

Bach – Cantata - BWV 44

 

Beaux Arts :

Francis Bacon

 

Cinéma :

David Lynch, Eraserhead

Sokurov, Mère et fils, Le soleil

Andrej Tarkowski

Werner Herzog

The Quay Brothers

 

Théâtre :

Théâtre du Radeau

Miguel Moreira & Romeu Runa, The Old King

Claude Régy

I want to liberate theater from all its purported missions, to let it be itself, all by itself. What I have are images, sensations, texts which affect me, music which makes me tremble. With these elements, we will attack the stage, allowing them to confront the necessary criterion of all theater: space.
Beyond these elements, I neither have nor want more. I want to keep open all possibilities of meaning, so that from this confrontation can be born unexpectable semantic links and connections. My intention is not intentional. If theater is to be autonomous, it should work in an autonomous manner, without being beholden to the text, the message, or any other element which is not properly theatrical. Everything will be constructed out of this confrontation, this clash between space and sense. The result, we could say with Deleuze, will be percepts.
This work will be a theatrical, performative research. To allow for this confrontation of sense and space, without teleology or a priori expectations, will demand much of the actors : great patience, generosity and productive power. The actors themselves, then, will take part in the creation of the work. It is not, then, about a director's imposition: the result will be, rather, a collective creation. I will not take the position of the subject of supposed knowledge. I would like to open a space of insecurity, doubt, ignorance, without the need to perform as the one who knows. The work will be without a master. It will be a process that will be thought, proposed, and performed by ourselves.
About the aesthetic we will be searching for: I consider that naturalism remains our biggest enemy. Let us search for abstraction in theater. Let us search for defiguration, for transfiguration. Let us go there with force. Let us strive beyond ourselves.
The actors will have to give themselves over with both body and soul, risking in this uncertain space their “mental health,” approaching the very limits of madness. Everything will be done without compromise. It is only here where we can find our creative power.
I'm not afraid of human pathos. A non-pathetic pathos.

It was in France that my discovery of theater changed the direction of my life. Since then, all my decisions have been directed towards theater and towards the possibility of free creation. This prior work was for me a sort of stylistic prefiguration, taking the form of a theatrical construction site: http://theatre-vitez.com/2012/05/festival-3-jours-et-plus-4/

As you can see, our largest expense will be the renting of a stage for rehearsal. At the time of writing, we are looking for spaces which will allow us to work for free. In general, however, our only options are cooperative organizations which are also short on funding, or spaces in which it is only possible to work for a very short time once a week. For our project, such conditions will not suffice. This would necessitate the exclusion of many theatrical elements, such as lighting, sound and stage design, due to logistical constraints. The rest of our budget is proof that we are making 'poor theater' (to borrow a term from Grotowski).In the event that some money remains after the completion of this project, it will be used for the second part of the diptych, Esquisse # 2: une ode, to be created by a larger team in the upcoming year.
What do you get for your contribution? Normally the first question in our capitalistic society. In fact, this is a hard question to answer when our 'product' is theater, because it is not a mechanically reproducible art form (which is, by the way, its beauty, its cruelty, its strength, its uniqueness). Of course you can get a free entrance to a show if you are in Marseille. If not you will at least get a postcard.
If you give a bit more, we will write about you. Yes! It's not a material compensation, but a personal one. A team of young men and women will write about you, perhaps on the other side of the world, and even if they don't know you at all. And if you give even a little more, we will send the texts to you.
If by chance giving is not a possibility, but you nevertheless are interested in the project we are working on, you can also share it with friends and family and spread the word.
If you have any questions, we would be happy to answer them. Don't hesitate. We will keep this site updated, and get a video of our next rehearsal session. The photos you are seeing come from our first three days of work.
Thank you for your interest,M.S.
