story:
The Alpha Rho Chapter of Sigma Chi at Lehigh University is raising money for its Derby Days philanthropy event.  We are raising money for the Huntsman Cancer Institute.  In addition, half of what we raise will go to the charity of the sorority that won.  


The Huntsman Cancer Institute is affiliated with the University of Utah Health Care System.  Funds going to Huntsman will help them research the disease to help find more effective treatments, provide free information to the public about cancer screening, prevent, treatments, etc, and help care for patients who have cancer.  HCI was chosen as Sigma Chi's preferred philanthropy because many Sigs and their families have been directly affected by cancer, the second-leading cause of death in the United States.

story:
We are Canterbury Shakespeare Festival...

We are an up-and-coming alfresco theatre experience that is dedicated to bringing the Canterbury and Kent communities together in a mutual love and celebration of the Bard and his works. We are comprised of a permanent committee of eight enthusiastic executives, with a raft of experience in theatre production, theatre education and performing and visual arts design. In their own way; each acts as a facilitator, to the army of volunteer actors, directors and other production team members that make up the rest of the Festival.

This year marks the second time that CSF will bring the Bard to Canterbury. With its continuation, the number of shows the Festival is producing has doubled, seeing adaptations of As You Like It, Macbeth, The Merchant of Venice and Twelfth Night being brought to some of the city's most picturesque green spaces this summer. In addition, CSF has begun to offer workshops and other outreach opportunities to schools in the local area, in order to help engage young people with one of theatre's greatest talents and the art in general.

Canterbury Shakespeare Festival does not function without the support of the public. The bitter irony is that in order to provide the best possible experience to our community - both the volunteers who make the Festival happen and the audiences who come to enjoy it - we must ask for funding and donations from it. However, these contributions help us to costume our actors; provide set and props to our directors; hire exciting and immersive venues; continue our work engaging young people year-round, and spread the word of the Festival to as many people as possible, growing our community and bringing it together.

The £1000 for which we are asking this year will take us the last step of the way toward making 2016's Festival truly great! Although many of our initial outlays have been covered, such as venue hire and insurance costs; there are a number of small expenses that the money from this campaign will ensure aren't bank-breaking:

  • Costuming can always been improved, and small, characterful accessories and highlights often make great last-minute additions.
  • The production of CSF merchandise would provide stylish (just look at our fantastic artwork and imagery!) and often practical mementos of the occasion, being offered in the first instance to our backers as rewards.
  • The Great British weather can often provide some challenges to producing an outdoor theatre festival. This money could provide some effective solutions.

Another way in which CSF could benefit from these funds, would be to use them to hold its first end-of-festival gala: a celebration of what we're confident will be another highly successful Festival, to which representatives from the press; notable local arts patrons, and some other members of the public would be invited. Such an event would cement our relationships with a number of our supporters and really help establish our intent to keep growing and improving.

As ever, any funds raised beyond the cost of the Festival will be reinvested into next year's effort. In this way, its quality will only continue to improve.

Other Ways You Can Help

We at CSF realise that not everybody is able to contribute financially, but there are still plenty of ways that you can help us out, even if that is so:

  • By sharing our Indiegogo campaign with those wondering where to make their next big investment.
  • By visiting and linking our website (www.canterburyshakespeare.co.uk) to those not yet in the know.
  • By following us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, and encouraging others to do the same.
  • And of course, by buying tickets at: https://thelittleboxoffice.com/canterburyshakes...

Contributor perks and rewards now available!

story:
Short Summary

A descendant of a slave, Al Arnold, tells his journey of embracing his Confederate heritage. His ancestor, Turner Hall, Jr., a Black Confederate, served as a body servant for two Confederate soldiers and an orderly for General Robert E. Lee. Hall's life's journey eventually led him to Hugo, Oklahoma where he established himself as the town's most distinguished citizen receiving acclaim from Black and White citizens alike for his service. In 1938, his journey continued to Pennsylvania as the last Civil War veteran from his community to attend the final Civil War veteran reunion, as a Black Confederate. He also traveled to New York City and was interviewed by the national talk radio show, "We, The People" in 1940.  This Stage Play highlights Hall's Journey through the discovery of an amazing African American Confederate discovery presented to us by Hall's great-great grandson, Al Arnold,  in his book, "Robert E. Lee's Orderly A Modern Black Man's Confederate Journey.  Al tells the story of Turner Hall, Jr., his personal Confederate journey and how family and faith has brought harmony to his new found heritage. Arnold argues for the revitalization of the lost Black history of the Civil War era. He bestows dignity and honor on his Confederate ancestor and challenges the traditional thoughts of modern African Americans. Arnold rests in his faith as the uniting force that reconciles our colorful past to our bright future. This play is the journey of a unique genealogy discovery and how one African American man came to understand his Confederate heritage in the South during a time of racial unrest.

 

The Impact

The overarching impact is Unity by:

 1 :Preserving history
 2: Honoring Blacks who served in the Civil War
 3: Protecting heritage
 4: Educating through the arts
 5: Defeating political correctness
 6: Promoting unity among different races and cultures.

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks to overcome is to convey the scope/content of the play in the proper light:  Although the play will highlight the role of Blacks in the Civil War by using real people, such as Turner Hall, Jr., Lee's Orderly and Slave of Nathan Bedford Forrest, it will also include the Journey of Arnold in his discovery of his Confederate Heritage while living in Mississippi and watching the Confederate Heritage debate from a different set of lens.   Funding is the primary challenge:

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Promote Heritage and NOT Hate by sharing this campaign!!

story:
Hi.  I’m Melissa Hinz, and my partners and I are back to bring you an even bigger, better Dancing Stars of Humboldt.  Last year was our first year, and it was a huge success!  But there's lots more to do!

My partners and I are committed to helping the talented local dancers in Humboldt County bring professional level performances to the public, and to creating a fantastic dance experience for the public at a ticket  price everyone can afford.


We are operating under the umbrella of North Coast Dance, a non-profit organization dedicated to dance education and performance, and the show will be presented at the beautiful Arkley Center for the Performing Arts in Eureka, on February 25th, 2017.

Here’s how it works:  In January, my partners and I will hold open auditions for all professional dance acts in any category:  Jazz, tap, ballet, folk, ethnic, modern, bellydance, hip-hop, and any other kind of dance you can think of.   We will find 15-20 of the very best professional acts in Humboldt County to be in the show.

Now, here’s what we need from you:  In order to get the word out, we need a little cash.  Because flyers and entry forms cost money.   We don’t need much.  In fact, if all of you send us $1….  or $10…. we should have enough to make Dancing Stars of Humboldt a huge success!

So please, send us a few bucks - maybe even just a price of that latte you get in the morning -  and post this on your facebook page!  And you can help make some Humboldt dreams come true!

story:
ENGLISH

Clarita and Pancho, a new musical.

Clarita and Pancho The Musical, is a Project that was born in a dream, literally. A dream that told the story of two kids that climbed a mountain to meet the big and magical tree of wishes. This curious tree has the power to grant wishes for whoever is able to get to it. Clarita and Pancho are two kids that want to overcome their very particular disabilities through the wishes they expect will come true.

This show talks about how we can communicate through means we thought were impossible and how “disabilities” will never be an obstacle to fulfill our dreams.

Clarita and Pancho is a totally original musical story that will tell the adventures of these two kids accompanied by three luminous story tellers that will sing and dance in rhythms of the 60’s; the era of teased hairstyles, Motown and clothes that irradiated colors. All of this will be shown in the best style of Broadway in a musical that will surely entertain every member of the family, not just children.


Creative sheet:

  • Original script: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
  • Playwright: Fernanda Godoy
  • Music and lyrics: Claudia Rojas
  • Vocal Coach and Voice Ensemble: Delia Dorta
  • Graphic Design: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
  • Scenography Design: Oscar Salomon
  • Makeup Design: Irene Casanova
  • Lighting Design: Valentina Sánchez
  • Costume Design: Freddy Mendoza
  • Choreography and Movement: Taba Luis Ramírez
  • Tap Choreography: Claudia Chafardet
  • Press and Media Coordination: Patrizia Aymerich
  • Executive Producers: Ímpetu Producciones and Grupo Fábula
  • General Production: Irene “Mila” Casanova and Armando González
  • Creative Direction: Taba Luis Ramírez
  • General Direction: Julián Izquierdo Ayala

Why are we looking for help?

Financing a play, let alone a musical, has become an incredibly difficult task in our country, in our current times. Production costs go from great costumes and ambitious scenography to the composition of original music created specifically for the play. Plus, the work of our creative team is incredibly valuable and we really want to pay them the way they deserve to be paid.

This is why we ask for your collaboration. Every help we can get will be appreciated and you will be helping us build the culture of our country. We will keep demonstrating that we have more than enough talent to present high quality theater performances of international standards, so we can keep rooting for the boost of culture in Venezuela.

ABOUT GRUPO FÁBULA

Grupo Fábula is a company for cultural promotion with 7 years of continuous work in the area of teaching dramatic arts to children, teenagers and young adults. We currently have over 130 students in three academic institutions and we keep on growing. We have done at least 25 different plays and the majority of them have been original pieces. Our endeavor in teaching dramatic arts has grown so much, that we have been able to achieve our biggest dream: doing musical theater.

Discovering young talents has been our motive for these past years so that we are able to work, not only as a school for the dramatic arts, but as a place of growth for those who will continue the legacy in the future and who will position the dramatic arts as a profession in our country.

ABOUT GRUPO ÍMPETU

Ímpetu Centro de Danza (Impetu Dance Center) is the first company of Grupo Ímpetu, and it is positioned in Venezuela as a center for education in the different styles of dance for children (starting from the age of 3) teenagers and young adults. With 12 years of experience, Ímpetu has over 4 facilities in Caracas, Venezuela and one new headquarters in Doral County, FL, USA, enrolling over 1,000 students that can develop an artistic life under the direction of cultural leaders guided by their founder and director, Daniel Solorzano.

Ímpetu Producciones (Impetu productions) is a company dedicated to the conceptualization, development and realization of special events and activities related with dance and theater at a national level. The company is part of Grupo Impetu, directed by Claudia Chafardet, and dedicated to the promotion of cultural spaces. It is made up of a staff of young professionals with ample knowledge in different areas, which makes for a dynamic, innovative, proactive and responsible company with a vision for business.  

ESPAÑOL

CLARITA Y PANCHO, un nuevo musical

Clarita y Pancho El Musical es un proyecto que nace, literalmente de un sueño. Un sueño que contó la historia de dos niños que subieron una montaña para encontrarse en la cima con el mágico y grande Árbol de los Deseos. Este curioso Árbol tiene el poder de cumplir un deseo a todo aquel que logra llegar a él. Clarita y Pancho son dos niños que quieren superar discapacidades muy particulares a través de deseos que esperan cumplir.

Este es un espectáculo que habla de cómo podemos comunicarnos a través de medios que creíamos imposibles y de cómo las discapacidades nunca serán un obstáculo para alcanzar nuestros sueños.

Clarita y Pancho es una historia musical completamente original que contará, a través de la música, la aventura de estos dos niños acompañados de tres luminosas narradoras que cantarán y bailarán al ritmo de sonidos que nos llevarán a los años 60’s, la era de los grandes peinados, el Motown y la moda llena de colores. Todo esto estará resumido en un musical al estilo Broadway que divertirá no solo a los pequeños de la casa sino a toda la familia

Ficha creativa:

  • Texto original: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
  • Dramaturgista: Fernanda Godoy
  • Música y Letras: Claudia Rojas
  • Arreglos vocales y Coach vocal: Delia Dorta
  • Diseño gráfico: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
  • Diseño de escenografía: Oscar Salomon
  • Diseño de Maquillaje: Irene Casanova
  • Diseño de iluminación: Valentina Sánchez
  • Diseño de Vestuario: Freddy Mendoza
  • Coreografía y movimiento: Taba Luis Ramírez
  • Coreografía de Tap: Claudia Chafardet
  • Coordinación de Prensa y Medios: PatriziaAymerich
  • Producción ejecutiva: Ímpetu Producciones
  • Producción general: Irene “Mila” Casanova, Armando González
  • Dirección creativa: Taba Luis Ramírez
  • Dirección General: Julián Izquierdo Ayala

¿POR QUÉ BUSCAMOS AYUDA?

Hoy en día en nuestro país se ha vuelto muy difícil con el pasar del tiempo el hecho de financiar un espectáculo y mucho más aún un espectáculo musical. Grandes vestuarios, una escenografía ambiciosa, música original compuesta específicamente para el proyecto son solo unos pocos de los rubros que la producción debe cubrir a nivel de gastos. Sin contar con que el trabajo de los creativos es un trabajo valiosísimo que buscamos sea remunerado como se debe.

Es por eso que pedimos tu colaboración. Cualquier ayuda será bienvenida y nos ayudará a seguir construyendo cultura en nuestro país y a seguir demostrando que tenemos talento de sobra con el que podemos presentar espectáculos con una calidad competitiva incluso a nivel internacional para seguir apostando al impulso cultural en Venezuela.

SOBRE EL GRUPO FÁBULA

El Grupo Fábula es una compañía de promoción cultural con 7 años de labor en formación de niños, adolescentes y jóvenes. Actualmente contamos con más de 130 alumnos dentro de tres instituciones escolares y seguimos creciendo. Hemos realizado más de 25 montajes, la mayoría de ellos de historias propias. Nuestro trabajo de formación en las artes escénicas ha ido tomando vuelo hasta llegar hoy en día a nuestra mayor meta: el teatro musical.

Descubrir jóvenes talentos ha sido nuestro móvil durante todos estos años para así funcionar más que cómo una escuela de artes, como un espacio de formación para aquellos que serán los que seguirán el legado en el futuro y quienes posicionarían a las artes escénicas como una profesión en nuestro país.

SOBRE EL GRUPO ÍMPETU

IMPETU Centro de Danza es la empresa pionera de Grupo IMPETU, se posiciona en Venezuela como un centro de formación en diferentes géneros de baile para niños y jóvenes a partir de 3 años. Con 12 años de experiencia ya cuenta con 4 sedes en Caracas, Venezuela y una sede en Doral, FL, reuniendo en total más de 1000 alumnos que hacen vida artística bajo la guía de un equipo de líderes culturales liderados por Daniel Solorzano.

Ímpetu Producciones es una empresa dedicada a la conceptualización, desarrollo, ejecución de eventos y actividades relacionadas con la danza y el teatro, de alcance nacional. Es parte del Grupo Ímpetu, dirigida por Claudia Chafardet, dedicada a la promoción de espacios culturales y está conformado por un staff de jóvenes profesionales que acumulan herramientas de trabajo en diferentes áreas para crear una empresa dinámica, innovadora, proactiva, responsable y con visión de negocios.

CAST

Claudia Rojas es Clarita

Taba Luis Ramírez es Pancho

Hana Kobayashi es Aretha

Claudia Santos es Diana

Stefany Frade es Patty

ART INSPIRATION/INSPIRACIÓN DEL ARTE

Preliminary Desings (Costume and Scenography)/ Diseños preliminares (Vestuario y Escenografía)

We will keep demonstrating that we have more than enough talent to present high quality theater performances of international standards, so we can keep rooting for the boost of culture in Venezuela.ABOUT GRUPO FÁBULAGrupo Fábula is a company for cultural promotion with 7 years of continuous work in the area of teaching dramatic arts to children, teenagers and young adults. We currently have over 130 students in three academic institutions and we keep on growing. We have done at least 25 different plays and the majority of them have been original pieces. Our endeavor in teaching dramatic arts has grown so much, that we have been able to achieve our biggest dream: doing musical theater.Discovering young talents has been our motive for these past years so that we are able to work, not only as a school for the dramatic arts, but as a place of growth for those who will continue the legacy in the future and who will position the dramatic arts as a profession in our country.ABOUT GRUPO ÍMPETUÍmpetu Centro de Danza (Impetu Dance Center) is the first company of Grupo Ímpetu, and it is positioned in Venezuela as a center for education in the different styles of dance for children (starting from the age of 3) teenagers and young adults. With 12 years of experience, Ímpetu has over 4 facilities in Caracas, Venezuela and one new headquarters in Doral County, FL, USA, enrolling over 1,000 students that can develop an artistic life under the direction of cultural leaders guided by their founder and director, Daniel Solorzano.Ímpetu Producciones (Impetu productions) is a company dedicated to the conceptualization, development and realization of special events and activities related with dance and theater at a national level. The company is part of Grupo Impetu, directed by Claudia Chafardet, and dedicated to the promotion of cultural spaces. It is made up of a staff of young professionals with ample knowledge in different areas, which makes for a dynamic, innovative, proactive and responsible company with a vision for business.  ESPAÑOLCLARITA Y PANCHO, un nuevo musicalClarita y Pancho El Musical es un proyecto que nace, literalmente de un sueño. Un sueño que contó la historia de dos niños que subieron una montaña para encontrarse en la cima con el mágico y grande Árbol de los Deseos. Este curioso Árbol tiene el poder de cumplir un deseo a todo aquel que logra llegar a él. Clarita y Pancho son dos niños que quieren superar discapacidades muy particulares a través de deseos que esperan cumplir.Este es un espectáculo que habla de cómo podemos comunicarnos a través de medios que creíamos imposibles y de cómo las discapacidades nunca serán un obstáculo para alcanzar nuestros sueños.Clarita y Pancho es una historia musical completamente original que contará, a través de la música, la aventura de estos dos niños acompañados de tres luminosas narradoras que cantarán y bailarán al ritmo de sonidos que nos llevarán a los años 60’s, la era de los grandes peinados, el Motown y la moda llena de colores. Todo esto estará resumido en un musical al estilo Broadway que divertirá no solo a los pequeños de la casa sino a toda la familiaFicha creativa:
Texto original: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
Dramaturgista: Fernanda Godoy
Música y Letras: Claudia Rojas
Arreglos vocales y Coach vocal: Delia Dorta
Diseño gráfico: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
Diseño de escenografía: Oscar Salomon
Diseño de Maquillaje: Irene Casanova
Diseño de iluminación: Valentina Sánchez
Diseño de Vestuario: Freddy Mendoza
Coreografía y movimiento: Taba Luis Ramírez
Coreografía de Tap: Claudia Chafardet
Coordinación de Prensa y Medios: PatriziaAymerich
Producción ejecutiva: Ímpetu Producciones
Producción general: Irene “Mila” Casanova, Armando González
Dirección creativa: Taba Luis Ramírez
Dirección General: Julián Izquierdo Ayala
¿POR QUÉ BUSCAMOS AYUDA?Hoy en día en nuestro país se ha vuelto muy difícil con el pasar del tiempo el hecho de financiar un espectáculo y mucho más aún un espectáculo musical. Grandes vestuarios, una escenografía ambiciosa, música original compuesta específicamente para el proyecto son solo unos pocos de los rubros que la producción debe cubrir a nivel de gastos. Sin contar con que el trabajo de los creativos es un trabajo valiosísimo que buscamos sea remunerado como se debe.Es por eso que pedimos tu colaboración. Cualquier ayuda será bienvenida y nos ayudará a seguir construyendo cultura en nuestro país y a seguir demostrando que tenemos talento de sobra con el que podemos presentar espectáculos con una calidad competitiva incluso a nivel internacional para seguir apostando al impulso cultural en Venezuela.SOBRE EL GRUPO FÁBULAEl Grupo Fábula es una compañía de promoción cultural con 7 años de labor en formación de niños, adolescentes y jóvenes. Actualmente contamos con más de 130 alumnos dentro de tres instituciones escolares y seguimos creciendo. Hemos realizado más de 25 montajes, la mayoría de ellos de historias propias. Nuestro trabajo de formación en las artes escénicas ha ido tomando vuelo hasta llegar hoy en día a nuestra mayor meta: el teatro musical.Descubrir jóvenes talentos ha sido nuestro móvil durante todos estos años para así funcionar más que cómo una escuela de artes, como un espacio de formación para aquellos que serán los que seguirán el legado en el futuro y quienes posicionarían a las artes escénicas como una profesión en nuestro país.SOBRE EL GRUPO ÍMPETUIMPETU Centro de Danza es la empresa pionera de Grupo IMPETU, se posiciona en Venezuela como un centro de formación en diferentes géneros de baile para niños y jóvenes a partir de 3 años. Con 12 años de experiencia ya cuenta con 4 sedes en Caracas, Venezuela y una sede en Doral, FL, reuniendo en total más de 1000 alumnos que hacen vida artística bajo la guía de un equipo de líderes culturales liderados por Daniel Solorzano.Ímpetu Producciones es una empresa dedicada a la conceptualización, desarrollo, ejecución de eventos y actividades relacionadas con la danza y el teatro, de alcance nacional. Es parte del Grupo Ímpetu, dirigida por Claudia Chafardet, dedicada a la promoción de espacios culturales y está conformado por un staff de jóvenes profesionales que acumulan herramientas de trabajo en diferentes áreas para crear una empresa dinámica, innovadora, proactiva, responsable y con visión de negocios.CASTClaudia Rojas es ClaritaTaba Luis Ramírez es PanchoHana Kobayashi es ArethaClaudia Santos es DianaStefany Frade es PattyART INSPIRATION/INSPIRACIÓN DEL ARTEPreliminary Desings (Costume and Scenography)/ Diseños preliminares (Vestuario y Escenografía)

story:
​Joylyn Secunda Productions presents The Moaning Yoni, an absurd solo comedy about sex, identity and new age ideals, at the Toronto Fringe Festival (July 5-16) and the Victoria Fringe Festival (August 23-September 3).

About the Show

Zoë, a college student desperately trying to be normal, resists the dictatorial pressure of her anthropomorphic vagina (or yoni), a no-bullshit Brooklyn-Jew with the wisdom of a sage. Together they cross the battlefield of Sex-Ed class, Tinder, and Tantric hippies. The show combines dialogue, physical comedy, dance and puppetry to transmit a hallucinatory coming of age story.

About the Artist

Joylyn Secunda is a Vancouver based actor, dancer, and puppeteer and graduate of the BFA Acting program. Favourite credits include Love, Lust & Lace (Gas Pedal Productions), HAIR (Renegade Arts Co.), Eurydice, The Bacchae 2.1, Marion Bridge (UBC Theatre). She currently teaches yoga classes and puppetry workshops, and tours schools with the puppet show, Kids on the Block with Cassie and Friends.

Asexual Visibility

The Moaning Yoni is inspired by Joylyn's experiences coming to identify as grey-ace on the asexual spectrum. Asexuality is the least known sexual orientation and our goal with this project is to raise awareness about this experience. At least 1% of the world's population is asexual and yet stories featuring asexual characters are extremely rare. We're striving to change that.

For more information on Asexuality check out http://www.asexuality.org/

You Can Help

Please donate what you can! Every little bit makes a difference!

Donations will go towards promotion materials (photoshoot, posters, handbills, add), transportation (plane ticket to Toronto), and payment for the puppet designer, costume designer, and director.

Stay Connected

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/joylynsecundaproductions/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/JoylynSecunda

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/joylynsecunda/

story:
Summary

 

 

  

The plot of the Musical "Central Park" with music by Dina Pruzhansky and book by Arnold Shvetsov, takes place in Central Park, NYC.  A family decides to spend a day at the park - and once they enter the Park, the adventures begin. The musical, that is built to be enjoyed by the whole family, features musical, dance and drama numbers for performers of all ages. The story is highly entertaining, humorous and informative.  It contains many surprises and unexpected turns, including breaking the barrier between the actors and the audience, engaging the public in a surprise conversation, and more - all while keeping the show at a high professional level in all of it's aspects. Currently, the musical is in development at the Shostakovich School of Art, Music and Dance, that provides extraordinary training and nurturing of  the artistic talents of it's  Performing Arts students.
 
The Musical "Central Park" has grown since it's inception, from a dream envisioned by a small group of like minded artists, to a vibrant multifaceted production that has already taken place in three locations in the metropolitan New York Area.
 

What we have achieved has been remarkable but we are not resting on our oars. That is why we are seeking support from fellow art fans and music lovers for the creation of KTA (Kids-Teenagers-Adults) Theater. This will be a first-of-its-kind as it will harness more talents in ways never thought achievable. We have great plans and our ambition is unshaken, what we lack is only your support.  The world is waiting for the realization of this dream of many, and you can make it happen with your contribution.

The Musical "Central Park" is sponsored , in part, by the Shostakovich School of Music, Art, and Dance in Brooklyn, NY.  To find out more about the Shostakovich School, click here.

The school is celebrating its 35 years, over the course of these 35 years approximately 10,000 students have graduated. The school takes part in many charitable concerts and also hosts it's own accounting concerts for the students' progress. Several tens of thousands of viewers have come to see the performances of talented current and graduate students.

Support Our Belvedere Knight

 

The purpose of this created theater isn't just to draw publicity to it's many performances, that interest a large audience, but to spark an interest in children and teenagers of all possible ethnic backgrounds for the arts. We believe that what is taught in school and in theater will attract children and especially teenagers and contributes to their strength as individuals, personal growth and mental immunity against the influence of the streets.  

The next production of the musical 'Central Park' is expected in the Fall of 2017.

We will honor all of our donors with tickets, T-shirts, souvenirs, and more. We will of course notify every contributor on the day and time of the production and will send a thank you note to each contributor.

What We Need & What You Get

In a word, we need your support.

The Musical "Central Park" is not-for-profit (NFPO) organization and all donations are tax deductible. 
 
We have an elaborated agenda and great plans to present exciting entertainment and talents like never before. We have the skill and the talents ready with more waiting to join. For the production of 'Central Park:The Musical', the team comprised of gifted children, teenagers and adults is ready, prepped and prepared. We don't have any lack of enthusiastic artists. All that is needed is your support and funding. 

We don’t plan on getting without giving, even in the short-run. The excitement can begin immediately. We are ready to show you what we are made of. 

SNEAK PEAK INTO A REHEARSAL PROCESS AND WORKSHOP PERFORMANCES: 

Golden Brown and Dapple Grey Horses
 
Some Fine Afternoon
 
A Magical Land
 

Wind On The Hill

Don't Say A Word

To Subscribe to our YouTube Channel, leave a review, or simply Like our videos, visit our YouTube Channel

 

SHORT BIOS OF OUR MAIN CREATIVE TEAM:

 

COMPOSER and MUSIC DIRECTOR, Dina Pruzhansky.  

Dina Pruzhansky is a Russian born, Israeli raised composer and pianist, based in New York. She  is a post-graduate alumna from Mannes School of Music, where she was awarded a continuous scholarship of merit, and a member of the Tony honored BMI Advanced Musical Theater Workshop. 

Dina Pruzhansky has been enjoying a diverse career, both as composer and pianist. Having her compositions featured at NYC venues such as Jazz at Lincoln Center, Weill Carnegie Hall, Merkin Hall, Bargemusic, Symphony Space, Le Poisson Rouge, as well internationally, Dina has recently made her WQXR debut in an exclusive 'Young Artist' program with the renown host Robert Sherman.

Dina Pruzhansky was named a finalist for the highly prestigious Fred Ebb Award for Excellence in Musical Theater writing, with the award-winning lyricist Matt Schatz. Her opera-theater show 'Shulamit', written and premiered in 2014, has had it's full production in 2016 in NYC. 

As a pianist, she has appeared in solo and chamber music recitals at the leading venues throughout the United States, Russia, Israel, Canada, Italy, Belgium and Germany, and has shared the stage with many distinctive artists, including soloists of the Metropolitan and San Francisco Operas, members of the Metropolitan Orchestra and others.

A passionate educator, she is the author of 'I CAN PLAY: Chopin' series of easy,accessible piano arrangements for beginners, and is currently serving as a faculty member at the 92Y School of Music and at the Turtle Bay Music School.

 

STAGE DIRECTOR and LIBRETTIST Arnold Shvetsov.

Arnold Shvetsov is a graduate of Moscow’s renowned GITIS (State Academy for Theatrical Arts, Moscow).

His work in Russia includes Goldoni’s THE QUARRELS IN CHIOGGIA at the Zlatoust State Theater, DOUBLE DOUBLE by Elice & Rees at Stanislavsky Moscow Drama Theater in Moscow and adaptations of the Grimm Brothers tale FRAU HOLLE as well as O’Henry’s THE RANSOM OF RED CHIEF, which has been running for more than 20 years (over 1000 performances!) at the Gogol Moscow Drama Theater in Moscow.

In the United States, directing credits include TWO POODELS by Simon Zlotnikov at the Aborns Art Center at the Henry Street Settlement, Chekhov’s UNCLE VANYA at the 78th Street Theater Lab and the Stravinsky opera MAVRA at Merkin Hall. Arnold also helmed a production of ISADORA AND SERGEI by S. Nazarenko that played at the Wondering Stars, the Russian-American Musical Theater in New York. In the last few seasons, Mr. Shvetsov has worked with Classical Presentations LLC directing the new production of QUEEN ESTHER by A. Markov and musical CENTRAL PARK by D. Pruzhansky and A. Shvetsov that had its world premieres at JCC In Manhattan, as well as ONE DAY AT THE OPERA THEATER by D. Fernandes, N. Leoni, A.Shvetsov at 92 Y Street, New York. Arnold staged CHAGALL. COLOR OF LOVE by Z. Sagalov, at the Chicago “By The Way" Theater.

Currently, he is set to impart the wealth of his experience and expertise to student as a part of his passion. This is very promising and delay cannot be afforded.

When successfully funded…

The first production, for which we are lined up, will be the musical by composer Dina Pruzhansky "Central Park". The story's synopsis involves children characters, who in a course of their play, find themselves in New York's Central Park, where they encounter various adventures situations and meet new "magical" friends. The musical is set for children,teenagers and adult performers (singers/actors/dancers) accompanied by orchestra. Our play may also accommodate several chorus scenes to include a group of children, some of whom may also play smaller parts in other scenes.

Not so long ago, the first production of the musical was held at the JCC of Manhattan. It was received with great enthusiasm by both young and adult viewers and the press. Currently the second edition of the musical is being prepared, which will involve even more young and adult participants. Central Park - one of the trademarks of the Big Apple. We are convinced that our performance will be the hallmark of KTA Theater and attract not only local residents, but also visitors of New York. 

The Impact

It would be of a great benefit and an unparalleled gift for the younger generation; by allowing them to work together with professional performers. Young actors would receive an invaluable experience from cooperating with  seasoned directors, composers, choreographers and other professionals in the arts.

Performances would be held at numerous theaters in New York and even beyond it's borders.

Young actors will study drama, voice, choreography, stage movement and stage speech. The acquiring of knowledge and creativity skills will enable young talents to apply their skills later in their life paths. Classes in the arts make human beings evolve spiritually and mentally, no matter what profession they're in. The Shostakovich school has received a great number of tokens of appreciation from the pupils' families.

KTA Theater will have its own rehearsal spaces at the school, but theater rental for public performance, as well as the creation, stage crew fees,and production materials are expensive. We invite you to become sponsors and friends of our theater for children and adults.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is not having this theater. This has made learning and musical self-expression unconsciously restricted. Students that will give anything to have their inner voice expressed in form of dance and music have been made to wait with disappointment due to the lack of production funds.

Our students should be encouraged to take the stage by storm and blow the world away with their amazing talents. They are born with these traits of greatness and our function and passion is harnessing and polishing it. Not having this theater has severely limited us in all that we do, but this is not yet fatal as we can quickly improve with funding and your support.

Other ways to help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So even if you love this idea but lack the resources to pledge to its success, there are some other ways you can use to ensure this.

You can win a Amazing gifts by spreading the word!

Please, use your social might! Like us on Facebook or write a blog post!

Follow us on Instagram

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.

  • It’ll be a real help to this campaign and to me if you share the information with friends on social media –Facebook, Twitter, etc. This will draw a crowd of fellow passionate persons that can do what you might not.
  • Word of mouth publicity is also equally effective.
  • Talking about it and sharing the link with friends, family and co-worker will jump-start this campaign and ensure its success.
  • You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.

Thank you so much!

Thanks in advance for your attention and consideration. We need your help to achieve this goal and make it a reality! Your help and support are essential to make this goal come to reality!

We look forward to seeing a positive response from you soon.

Click and donate to make a difference.  

Remember, The Musical "Central Park" is not-for-profit (NFPO) organization and all donations are tax deductible. 

Don’t forget to get the word out to friends by sharing it—remember sharing is caring.

Students that will give anything to have their inner voice expressed in form of dance and music have been made to wait with disappointment due to the lack of production funds.Our students should be encouraged to take the stage by storm and blow the world away with their amazing talents. They are born with these traits of greatness and our function and passion is harnessing and polishing it. Not having this theater has severely limited us in all that we do, but this is not yet fatal as we can quickly improve with funding and your support.Other ways to helpSome people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So even if you love this idea but lack the resources to pledge to its success, there are some other ways you can use to ensure this.You can win a Amazing gifts by spreading the word!
Please, use your social might! Like us on Facebook or write a blog post!

Follow us on Instagram

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.
It’ll be a real help to this campaign and to me if you share the information with friends on social media –Facebook, Twitter, etc. This will draw a crowd of fellow passionate persons that can do what you might not.
Word of mouth publicity is also equally effective.
Talking about it and sharing the link with friends, family and co-worker will jump-start this campaign and ensure its success.
You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.
Thank you so much!Thanks in advance for your attention and consideration. We need your help to achieve this goal and make it a reality! Your help and support are essential to make this goal come to reality!We look forward to seeing a positive response from you soon.Click and donate to make a difference.  Remember, The Musical "Central Park" is not-for-profit (NFPO) organization and all donations are tax deductible. Don’t forget to get the word out to friends by sharing it—remember sharing is caring.

story:
"JABEZ The Rainmaker" @ SOUNDBITES 5.0

Hi, I'm Tom Hyndman a Composer/Book writer/Lyricist of Musical Theatre. My Musical Theatre introduction began in college in Maryland, where I studied with Sarah Schlesinger (Chair of The Tish School of Musical Theatre Writing at New York University.) My musical "FICTITIOUS" had it's premier reading at the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington D.C.and "World Wide Podcast "Live" Podcast ". From there "Fictitious" has had several performances in New York and Washington D.C. and was selected into the Off Broadway Alliance's Mentorship Program in New York City. Recently, I have been studying Musical Development with Stephen Schwartz ( Pippin/Godspell/ Wicked) at the ASCAP/Disney/Dreamworks Workshop in New York. Also, now in development is my new Musical "Jabez The Rainmaker" The Story of Cinco de Mayo.

"JABEZ The Rainmaker" is the story of a young Mexican teen in the 1880's ,who has been appointed "Tribal Rainmaker". Problem is...He has no idea how to make it rain and to make matters worse....He is scared to death of thunder and lightening ! More than once the show has been referred to as "Aladdin in Mexico".   I will be presenting an excerpt performance from this  Romantic/Musical/Comedy on Memorial Day 2018 at the Signature Theatre in NYC.

This will be  the first major step into the world of live theatre for "JABEZ The Rainmaker". That's why this first step is so important. You don't often get a second chance to present at this level. That is why it is imperative for one to bring their "A" game to the spotlight.  My hope is to bring a polished performance, that will create a hunger and thirst for the audience to want to see and hear more.

This is why your participation is so important and needed. As many of you know everything is a little more expensive in NYC. Especially when it comes to mounting any type of production  there. Although, SOUNDBITES is an annual  "Benefit"/ "Not for Profit" event. It still has many expenses to be met. "Theatre Now New York ","Musical Theatre International" and "Disney Theatrical" are covering the major cost, such as the Theatre rental, Advertisement, Sound and Lighting and 180 hours of free Rehearsal Space and Ticket Processing Expenses. 

Each show is responsible for finding and hiring a Director, stage manger, choreographer , Musical Director, cast, musicians ,costumes and props. These are out of pocket expenses I will need to raise hopefully with your help.    The goal to fund this performance is achievable, with help from  contributors such as you. 

What We Need & What You Get

                   JABEZ PRELIMINARY BUDGET DRAFT

                     ITEM                                                      COST

Props                                                                          $100.00

Director /Choreographer                                       $700.00

Musical Director                                                       $300.00

Executive Producer                                                  $350.00

Cast                                                                              $708.00

Stage Manager                                                           $100.00

Musicians                                                                     $300.00

Rehearsal Space( Auditions only)                           $150.00

Stg. Mgr. & Dept. EXP                                                $50.00

Casting Expenses                                                        $150.00

General & Administrative                                           $50.00  

Miscellaneous                                                                $100.00  

TOTAL PRODUCATION COST                                   $3,058

 

WHAT YOU GET !

I'm excited to be able to offer you some great INSENTIVES & PERKS just for contributing!

Please go to the "PERKS PAGE" for details before you make your contribution 

The Impact

Your contribution can make an impact in our world. Supporting the arts is contributing to our ever growing diverse cultures. This show in particular, even though it is a Romantic Comedy set in a time well over a century  ago. We find we are still dealing with some of the issues of the past that have managed to confront us and confound us, in the here and now. 

You are also investing in a project that has taken on  a life of it's own! A life to goes beyond SOUNDBITES 5.0.  "JABEZ The Rainmaker" Will hopefully make it's way into the hearts of the audience and industry professionals...Producers, Theatre Companies ,etc.  I have already, written  "JABEZ The Rainmaker " as a book and hopes of an Animated film version is a desire to be fulfilled .

I have been fortunate to have been able to make my living as a writer/storyteller/ musician all of my life. It's been a journey that has been fulfilling, rewarding and exciting! I invite you to take this next one with me. From the desert plains of old Mexico to the lights of New York City's Broadway. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We all know there are no guarantees in any investment.  That also holds true in the Arts & Entertainment field. Although, I feel confident having been down this road before, that I have learned to surround myself with professional ,confident  and passionate people. Artist who are more than able and willing to put the very best performance achievable onto the stage. As far as for the material to be presented. I feel very confident that the story and music is very marketable. I have already met with Disney Theatrical who has reviewed the material and feels it is ready for the stage and even has the potential to be made into an animated film. 

  OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I know not everyone is able to contribute. But, there are others ways to help ,like sharing this site and my videos with others. It's as easy as just clicking "Share" on your page.  Thank you for taking the time for even looking at this request. If you are able to make a contribution, no matter how  great or small. It is truly appreciated.  Again, Thanks and Take Care!

Tom Hyndman

story:
A boy, a girl, and a band class. 

2007. Dartmouth, Nova Scotia. A high school band class. A new teacher from Toronto wants to be an inspiration to his jaded students but is afraid to come out to them. A boy bullies a girl in insidious ways until she takes matters into her own hands. An act of violence at a school dance fractures the community. A Bear Awake in Winter is a dark, funny, and difficult story about the fight to stand up for yourself.

Written and directed by Ali Joy Richardson (proud Maritimer-band-geek turned Toronto-theatre-artist), the play has been selected for the mainstage of Toronto's curated Next Stage Theatre Festival. This is an unparalleled opportunity to showcase this play (and outstanding team) to a wide audience and key industry leaders.  

A Bear Awake in Winter amplifies teenaged and queer perspectives in the #MeToo conversation and was a finalist for the 2018 Safe Words New Canadian Play Award. It was developed in residency with the Canadian Stage Company’s RBC Emerging Artist Program.

Cast: Michaela Di Cesare, Andy Trithardt, Danny Pagett, Bria McLaughlin, Natasha Ramondino, Andrew Di Rosa, & Hershel Blatt
Creative team: Ali Joy Richardson, Bryn Kennedy, Lucy McPhee, Steph Raposo, & Neil Silcox
Produced by: Binocular Theatre (Ali Joy Richardson & Bryn Kennedy)

Join the band. 

Your contribution will support:

  • Paying our cast & creative team - a fearless team of 12 (most of us are young artists for whom Next Stage Theatre Festival is a significant professional step)
  • Renting/transporting instruments - can't have a band without 'em
  • Rehearsal spaces - alas, this play doesn't fit in Ali's apartment

We're grateful to have some of our production costs covered by the Toronto Arts Council and in-kind support from Theatre Passe Muraille. We need your help to raise the remaining funds for this ambitious production. 

Strike a chord. 

Thank you for helping us bring A Bear Awake in Winter to a wide audience (including the festival's first high school matinee!). We believe in this play's ability to shine a light on bullying, resilience, and forgiveness by revisiting the familiar spaces of teenaged bedrooms, a 2007 school dance, and the band classroom. 

Thank you for your donation and for sharing our campaign. See you in band class.

A Bear Awake in Winter by Ali Joy Richardson
January 10-20, 2019 @ Factory Theatre in the Next Stage Theatre Festival
More info and tickets here (on sale November 26)

story:
Hello! We are Project Possibility. We were founded on the notion that anything is possible. We thrive to create, to imagine and to play with no boundaries within theatre. Keeping our minds open to every possibility.


We are putting on our first play in two weeks, called Method Man. This play is a new piece of Irish theatre, and written by one of our actors. To tell you more about our play here is a brief summary of the play: 

The story unfolds in Hollywood, in the year 1948, Jim Evans embarks on his new film, 'Distractions,' his last chance to save his dying out career. He is joined in this venture by a wonderous cast, which includes; the over ambitious actress Emilie Taylor Lee, who's sole goal is fame and fortune, the veteran actor David Banini who tries to live up to his heartthrob past, the current heart throb Roger Mills who learns what it is to be a supporting role for the first time, american sweet heart Melanie Cusack joins the cast to continue her ever expanding fan base, and new kid on the block Sid Watson who wants to prove that he can do it and can live up to the high expections people have of him. He constantly doubts himself which brings him tumbling into the world of the what if? 

The question is how far will he take it? How powerful is the what if?

Outside the acting world is reporter Sally Doren, who is sick of being underappreciated in her work place, thinks she has found her big story. She just needs to convince down-on-his luck Detective John Erikson to take it on.Will he listen? Is this her story?

I welcome you to the world of the what if. The world of the method. Where anything will happen.

With all that said we are trying to raise money to put on our wonderful play. Donations will go towards paying for the use of the theatre (the majority of the funds will go to this), costumes &props (to get a good feel of the 1940s) and posters (to help promote our show).

We have worked hard and would apperciate any help. We have some fabulous perks including free tickets to see the show, music from the show, stills of the cast and a copy of the script it self.

Thank you so much for talking the time to read this, and thank you again if you choose to make a donation. No donation is to small. 


Thank you, and I hope to see you at the show.

story:
WareArt: SubTerra

We at Exquisite Corpse Company are excited to announce our next integrated arts event, the 2014 WareArt Festival: SubTerra.

SubTerra evokes the ideas of subversion and counter-culture, the unseen life that teems beneath any urban landscape; the unlikely and the extraordinary, the buried and the broken.

The WareArt Festival is a three weekend event that brings together the creative minds of over 50 different artists : designers, playwrights, directors, actors, and artists of all stripes to explore this years theme SubTerra.

Over three weeks we will showcase 8 new fashion artists, and 4 new plays inspired by those subterranean designs.

When? May 29th - June 14th!

                                         Thursday May 29th

                            SubTerra Performative Fashion Show

                                @ Galapagos Art Space DUMBO

Join the Exquisite Corpse Company as Designers showcase their SubTerra inspired looks in a one night only avant-garde fashion show!

                                               June 5th-14th

                               SubTerra One-Act Play Festival 

                                   @ HERE Arts Center NYC

Then join us as we  premier four SubTerra fashion inspired plays, performed at HERE Arts Center. This production is a part of SubletSeries@HERE, HERE’s curated rental program, which provides artists with subsidized space and equipment, as well as technical support.

UnEquilibrium        
By Blake Bishton
Directed by Julia Sears

Featuring: Ryan Zachary Ward, Nicole Kontolefa , Emma Walton 

Anon
By Matthew Minnicino
Directed by Jenny Syder

Featuring: Tess Howsam, Caitlin Goldie, Lauren Swan Potras, Sarah Elizabeth Grace

Three Hours
By Laura Zlatos
Directed by Karyn Joy DeYoung
Featuring: Caroline Gart, Jack Fellows, David Rysdhal, Clairen Rothrock

Night, Still
By Hannah Bisewski
Directed by Tara Elliott 

Featuring: Natalie Kropf, Jeanne Joe Perrone, Brendon Sokler, Julia Barry, John Graham, Emily Steck and Blaire O'Leary

We are a little more than month away from opening, and spending every moment rehearsing, designing, building and dreaming!


Our Story...

The Exquisite Corpse Company LLC is a Brooklyn based, integrated performance art company that develops new work borne of collaboration between artists of all mediums. In doing so, we create a transformative, immersive event wherein theater, film, visual installation, music, and dance collide, repel, and interweave.

This is our third year as a company. We premiered our fist production, an original play by company member Tess Howsam, at the NYC International Fringe Festival and the Encore Series at the SoHo Playhouse. Last year we mounted our first main-stage production ODD.A.SEE; an ambitious retelling of Homer's classic in a 4,500 square foot space, and involved over 30 artists working in various mediums to create a complete immersive experience.

Above all, we believe in creating a community of young artists in New York who inspire and create together, and who forward our mission of making theater approachable and newly relevant to everyone.


Why We Need Your Help!

Expenses are starting to pile up, and our company fund is starting to run dry. In order to make WareArt:SubTerra a reality, we need to raise $10,000.

Why so much money, you ask???

Here is a rough breakdown:

$5000 to rent space

$2000 Set/Costume budget

$1400 Fashion Designer budget

$500 Insurance

$500 Publicity printing, and online advertising

$350 Transportation

$250 Lighting

$50 Printing costs

Not to mention: Everything you donate is tax deductible!!

That's good news for your taxes, but it also means that we have an external organization providing intense oversight of how every dollar is spent. In other words - you can be sure that every dollar you donate will be put to good use for the company and this production.

How You Can Help

Every little bit helps, and we can't do this without you! Please consider donating whatever you can.

As thanks for your donation, you'll get one of these super awesome gifts (shown on the right) from our creative team.

We will build WareArt:SubTerra from your generosity, and are extraordinarily grateful for any contribution you can make.

Other Ways to Help

Come see WareArt:Subterra and spread the word!

Share this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter or wherever else you make yourself known. We are so grateful for any and all help we can get, so thank you in advance for your generous support! Find us on Facebook, twitter, and Instagram!

To You

We are supremely confident in the merits of this project, and we have put together an incredible team of collaborators-- writers, actors, designers and crew. We know this is an ambitious undertaking but we are energized by the challenges, and excited to share this brilliant project with YOU!

Love and thanks from the Core Corpses,

Tess Howsam, Dana Steinhoff, Blaire O'Leary, Emma Walton, Blake Bishton, Karyn Joy DeYoung, Katie Medved, Sarah Gosses, and Katrina Day.

...and the cast, writers, and artists of WareArt:SubTerra.

This production is a part of SubletSeries@HERE, HERE’s curated rental program, which provides artists with subsidized space and equipment, as well as technical support.UnEquilibrium        By Blake BishtonDirected by Julia SearsFeaturing: Ryan Zachary Ward, Nicole Kontolefa , Emma Walton AnonBy Matthew MinnicinoDirected by Jenny SyderFeaturing: Tess Howsam, Caitlin Goldie, Lauren Swan Potras, Sarah Elizabeth GraceThree HoursBy Laura ZlatosDirected by Karyn Joy DeYoungFeaturing: Caroline Gart, Jack Fellows, David Rysdhal, Clairen RothrockNight, StillBy Hannah BisewskiDirected by Tara Elliott Featuring: Natalie Kropf, Jeanne Joe Perrone, Brendon Sokler, Julia Barry, John Graham, Emily Steck and Blaire O'LearyWe are a little more than month away from opening, and spending every moment rehearsing, designing, building and dreaming!Our Story...The Exquisite Corpse Company LLC is a Brooklyn based, integrated performance art company that develops new work borne of collaboration between artists of all mediums. In doing so, we create a transformative, immersive event wherein theater, film, visual installation, music, and dance collide, repel, and interweave.This is our third year as a company. We premiered our fist production, an original play by company member Tess Howsam, at the NYC International Fringe Festival and the Encore Series at the SoHo Playhouse. Last year we mounted our first main-stage production ODD.A.SEE; an ambitious retelling of Homer's classic in a 4,500 square foot space, and involved over 30 artists working in various mediums to create a complete immersive experience. Above all, we believe in creating a community of young artists in New York who inspire and create together, and who forward our mission of making theater approachable and newly relevant to everyone.Why We Need Your Help!Expenses are starting to pile up, and our company fund is starting to run dry. In order to make WareArt:SubTerra a reality, we need to raise $10,000.Why so much money, you ask???Here is a rough breakdown:$5000 to rent space$2000 Set/Costume budget$1400 Fashion Designer budget$500 Insurance$500 Publicity printing, and online advertising$350 Transportation$250 Lighting$50 Printing costsNot to mention: Everything you donate is tax deductible!! That's good news for your taxes, but it also means that we have an external organization providing intense oversight of how every dollar is spent. In other words - you can be sure that every dollar you donate will be put to good use for the company and this production.How You Can HelpEvery little bit helps, and we can't do this without you! Please consider donating whatever you can.As thanks for your donation, you'll get one of these super awesome gifts (shown on the right) from our creative team.We will build WareArt:SubTerra from your generosity, and are extraordinarily grateful for any contribution you can make.Other Ways to HelpCome see WareArt:Subterra and spread the word! Share this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter or wherever else you make yourself known. We are so grateful for any and all help we can get, so thank you in advance for your generous support! Find us on Facebook, twitter, and Instagram!To YouWe are supremely confident in the merits of this project, and we have put together an incredible team of collaborators-- writers, actors, designers and crew. We know this is an ambitious undertaking but we are energized by the challenges, and excited to share this brilliant project with YOU!Love and thanks from the Core Corpses,Tess Howsam, Dana Steinhoff, Blaire O'Leary, Emma Walton, Blake Bishton, Karyn Joy DeYoung, Katie Medved, Sarah Gosses, and Katrina Day....and the cast, writers, and artists of WareArt:SubTerra.

story:
Compagnie Métamorphose est une association de promotion, et de création de spectacles, de festivals et d'événements en rapport avec l'Art et la culture, sous toutes ses formes et origines.

Cette association fonctionne sans aucune subvention d'aucune sorte afin de poursuivre un chemin sans concession, seules les contributions volontaires et les artistes sont les piliers de nos projets !

Les deux dernières réalisations de Compagnie Métamorphose ont été "Juste la fin du monde " de Lagarce et " Diablogues " de Dubillard, dans des registres tout à fait différents.

En 2013, Compagnie Métamorphose a cristallisé le festival ScèneFolies, grâce à la volonté de tous les artistes qui s'expriment sur la vidéo en lien ci-dessus.


Ce projet avec lequel je viens vers vous aujourd'hui, c'est le rêve de tout acteur et de tout spectateur.

Une création, vierge de toute interprétation, immaculée. Jamais dite, jamais jouée, cette pièce est un morceau de bravoure, un texte fort et cinglant comme rarement donné !

Un texte à vivre!  Rimbaud  en Afrique, loin du poète de ses jeunes années, un homme au bilan d'une vie d'aventures et de voyages, de folie.

Pour ces (presque) deux heures de scène : Un acteur

 un texte et... Cinq panneaux

 Un aperçu du rendu avec de simple panneaux rigides

La toile cyclorama tendue permet les projections.

Comme illustré ici


qui seront le décor de cette chambre d'hôpital d'Aden en Afrique, en ce 8 mai 1891.

Cinq panneaux de toile, cyclorama ignifuge de 2,5 mètres par 3 montées sur tubes d'aluminium. Chacun de ces panneau revient à 550 euros et permettra la diffusion de lumières servant de scénographie. Bien sûr 5 x 550 = 2750, les 250 euros supplémentaires correspondent aux frais de PayPal et Indiegogo, tout simplement.

Sur un budget prévisionnel de 6000 euros, ont été déjà financés les lumières et le son, ainsi que les journées de répétitions, les costumes et maquillages, l'enregistrement en studio de la bande sonore.

Une aide sera la bienvenue pour boucler l'addition. Il nous faut le matériel pour la réalisation de ces panneaux. Nos fournisseurs sont la société Volver France pour les toiles et cyclorama et la société Centurions pour les éléments de structure aluminium.

Bien entendu, en plus des compensations mentionnées, nous pourrons fournir copie des factures d'achat aux contributeurs ( afin de justifier de notre démarche et de l'utilisation des fonds récoltés ), ainsi qu'un justificatif au fin de dégrèvement fiscaux. 

Nous avons besoin de vous en ces temps où la culture et la création sont de plus en plus malmenées... Contribuez, même peu, même un peu.

D'avance merci.


Quelques mots sur l'acteur

« Dan De Millo »



Né en 1969, DAN s'est consacré au métier d'acteur dès ses plus jeunes années, suivant, puis animant les ateliers scolaires où il joue déjà Labiche, Courteline, Tchéckov, Anouilh, Camus.

C'est donc tout naturellement qu'il a suivi les cours d'Art Dramatique de Muriel Chaney au conservatoire de Nice dont il sortira gratifié d'un premier prix à l'unanimité en 1991.

Dans la même période sa rencontre et son travail d'acteur avec Daniel Mesguich (1987)  vont lui ouvrir les horizons de la créativité et de la démesure de la scène.

Après un bref passage au cours Florent, et une année riche au sein de la troupe de l'Alliance Française de Grasse (direction artistique Georges Descrières) où il jouera Goldoni dans tout le sud de la France, il décide de se consacrer essentiellement au théâtre décentralisé et participe à la vie des quartiers et de villes et villages dans cet esprit jusqu'en 2008.

Ces deux décennies lui offriront l'opportunité de créer et jouer de multiples spectacles

De faire quelques apparitions sur le grand écran : « Déjà mort » réalisé par Olivier Dahan / Casting : Olivier Carbone, « Femme fatale » réalisé par Brian de Palma....

Ainsi que dans la petite lucarne : « Brigade niçoise », « Famille d’accueil »...

Mais surtout de créer « La Compagnie Métamorphose ».

Installé sur le Bassin d'Arcachon, et toujours dans la même philosophie décentralisée, il  revient sur le devant de la scène en montant « juste la fin du monde » de J.L. Lagarce (où sa mise en scène remarquable sera soulignée par une belle interprétation du rôle de Louis) puis « Diablogues », d'après R.Dubillard joué jusqu'au Théâtre de Ménilmontant. Dans le même temps il sera le créateur et l'organisateur du festival de spectacle vivant ScèneFolies.

Fidèle aux valeurs de partage et de transmission, il donne de nombreux ateliers et stages en milieu scolaires et pour des organismes à caractère social.

Dan est actuellement en répétition avec Aloïs Christ, auteur, pour la création de sa pièce :   « Comédie de la soif, la dernière nuit de Rimbaud à Aden » en partenariat avec la salle " L'Accordeur " de Saint-Denis de Pile ( 33910 ) que nous remercions ici de sa confiance et son implication dans cette aventure.


Le mot de l'auteur, Aloïs Christ :



En 2002, quand j’imagine la dernière nuit de Rimbaud à Aden, c’est à une fiction que je songe. L’ébauche sera vite remisée dans un tiroir 3 ans durant, avant que je ne l’exhume, les idées plus claires. Ce sera un monologue, réaliste mais pas biographique.

Que s’est-il passé ce soir du 8 mai 1891, à quelques heures d’embarquer sur l’Amazone pour un retour contraint en France ? Quelle tempête supposée agita ce crâne si singulier ? Voilà ce qui m’a intéressé, hanté, pour tout dire.

Les spécialistes pourront me réfuter, je m’en moque. C’est en amateur que je m’invite à cette soirée, du latin amator…celui qui aime. Et s’il me fallait une reconnaissance, je la tiens de Laurent Terzieff qui soutint mon travail en 2005, avant qu’il ne trouve un éditeur en 2010, un petit éditeur belge (tiens, tiens…) faute d’éditeur français partant pour cette aventure immobile.

10 ans, 16 versions et bien des projets avortés plus tard, c’est Philippe Geneste, professeur de français  qui, découvrant Comédie de la Soif, l’offre à Dan de Millo, comédien avec lequel il travaille depuis plusieurs années. Le texte lui plaît aussi. Il cherche un monologue. Nous nous rencontrons, nous tombons rapidement d’accord. Ses idées de mise en scène et d’interprétation me séduisent. Chose rare, nous avons à peu près la même musique en tête pour faire chanter ce texte…

Son énergie, son enthousiasme ramènent à la vie un projet que j’avais fini par enterrer. Qu’il en soit encore remercié ici, tout comme Philippe Geneste qui a permis cette rencontre.

Grand merci bien sûr à L’Accordeur de Saint Denis de Pile de recevoir Dan en résidence pour peaufiner cette création et l’accueillir ce 19 juin 2015 pour la première.

story:
The Shape of a Girl

Hello, my name is Jenny Daigle.  I was born and raised in Red Lake, Ontario but I am now living in Rosebud, Alberta in my fourth and final year at Rosebud School of the Arts.  As a fourth-year student, it is a requirement to produce and act in a show. Holy crap, I know right?? 

I've chosen to produce and act in the one-woman show Shape of a Girl by Joan McLeod.  Not only will this be my first time ever producing a play but it will also be my first time performing solo for an hour and a half.  I must be crazy... But it is a very good play and I love it dearly.  But I didn't stop at just performing it here in Alberta.  I want to bring it back to Red Lake, Ontario, my hometown!  Rosebud is an 18-hour drive from home, so many of my friends and family have never seen my work.  

One of the biggest things I'm discovering is that funding a play gets expensive.  Here's where you can help.

What I Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of what I'm asking for:

Production: $250.00

This covers all of my production costs like building a set, buying costumes, props, ect.

Rental: $200.00

I am performing this show in the Gym space at the Rosebud Community Hall, and to rent the space for rehearsals and shows, it costs money.

Scripts: $150.00

Each member of my production crew needs a script of their own. It adds up pretty quick.

Gas: $400.00

My car is pretty cheep on gas, but driving to Red Lake and back is a long way.  

Indiegogo fees: $50.00

Indiegogo takes a small percentage of the money I raise.  I've accounted for this by adding more onto my goal.


Enough of what I need, let's talk about what you could get!  Some perks could include a group Stage Combat lesson taught by me, a wire ornament of my Shape of a Girl logo, a half-hour chat with me about the whole process or any questions you may have about the show, or even a Photo Book, with pictures and journal entries tracking my journey from rehearsals to opening to the trip, shows and workshops in Red Lake!

The Impact

I hope that this show can have a positive impact on those who see it.  Even though it deals with pretty heavy subject matter, I still see a hope and a light thought it.  It's a show about a girl caught on the persecutor side of pretty vicious bullying, and feeling trapped.  I was surprised how much I connected to this play because I haven’t had a lot of personal experience with bullies.  And although that is the central theme in the play, I think it deals with more issues than just bullying.  I see the story of a child, trapped by fear and yet finding her courage.  I see a young girl discovering what it is to be a woman.  I see a teenager, enduring through trials that leave her changed and stronger.  I think that anyone can relate to this story and my wish is that people will come away from this story empowered and encouraged in their own lives, to stand up to fear and find bravery.

Your contributions will be the nuts and bolts that hold this show, this story together.  Without your help, I would not be able to tell this story that is becoming more important to me every time I read it.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pray.  I’m going to be under a lot of stress and have a lot of work to do, so pray for peace of mind, strength, and motivation

  • Like or share this video on Facebook.

  • Or just plain spread the word! In whatever ways you can.

Any or all of these will help me substantially
Thank you for contributing, however you choose to do it.  I wouldn't be able to do this without you!
